Unfortunately, this happened before the more powerful spirits had the opportunity to reverse the damage done.
Does that mean that Machiko-san and Maeko-chan are--
They don't belong in this world, although neither of them likely realize this. They were much alike human toddlers when they first arrived in this world.
I slowly started to understand the reason why the fox spirits and the villagers were on such bad terms.
Anyone would be restless if beings from another world, that you had never heard of, suddenly showed up at your doorstep.
Is that why there is so much tension between them and the villagers?
I'm afraid that the fox sisters became the victims of a misunderstanding.
You see, Machi-tan and Maeko-chan aren't the only spirits within this realm. There are others, which has caused things to escalate.
You mean there are other fox spirits?
Not fox spirits, but other spirits. They were sent into this realm just like the sisters, but unfortunately they were sent rather far from here.
While Machi-tan and Maeko-chan were close enough for me to care for them, the others weren't so lucky.
What do you mean? Did something happen to them?
Along with Maeko-chan and Machi-tan, four... four other spirits were sent here when the worlds briefly merged.
Unlike the fox sisters, those four didn't have anyone to watch over them, and as a result, they grew rather spoiled and wild.
So, what you're saying is...
Spirits going wild? It sounded like a recipe for trouble.
Yes, they grew oblivious of the way human society worked, and their behavior made humans mistake them for monsters.
Even now, those girls and their games are mistaken as acts of violence, and as a result, tension arose between the spirits and humans.
So, Machiko-san and Maeko-chan are discriminated against because of those spirits?
You could say that, yes.
Then, why didn't you try to stop them?
Because I can't leave this forest. I am the guardian spirit of this shrine. I cannot leave my domain.
I couldn't help but wonder what purpose all this talk about spirits served. Could it have had something to do with finding my way back home?
Do you think solving the problem with these spirits could be my ticket out of here?

Possibly. I wouldn't be surprised if dealing with those spirits would solve the problems between the spirits and humans. It would be difficult to track them down, but there may be an opportunity for you soon.
An opportunity?
I'm sensing one of them, heading through the forest towards the village.
If you can convince Machi-tan and Maeko-chan to help you protect the village, the villagers might be willing to accept them.
That did make sense. If Machiko and Maeko were seen protecting the village from a possible threat, they might be forgiven for the panties incident.
Do you think it'll work?
Only time will tell~ For now, you better get the girls and make haste towards the village before the wild spirit causes any more damage.
Nodding my head in agreement I quickly ran outside, trying to think of how I could convince Machiko and Maeko to help me save the village.

Surely, they would be better off known as heroes rather than pranksters. However, I doubted that the sisters held feelings of fondness toward the villagers, considering their continued treatment of the two girls.
I wonder how he'll solve the challenge set before him...
I found Machiko and Maeko talking near the steps leading back into the forest. The two girls looked like they were playing a game similar to hopscotch on the wide shrine steps.
It was time for me to figure out how to convince the girls.
Ah! Taka-kun! Is everything alright? You look worried.
Tsuyuri told me something interesting.
Oh! What was it? Did she... tell you onee-sama's bust size?
MAEKO!
Owiee...
Haha, no, nothing like that. And even if she offered to, I would've said no. I'm a gentleman, after all.
She told me about some recent events, and I think I've found a way to get you both accepted by the village.
Wait, what? What did she tell you? She has not told us a thing!
She didn't go into too many details. She just told me that some wild spirits caused a lot of trouble for the villagers and gave you guys a bad reputation.
If we can convince the villagers that the other spirits are just playing, maybe we can figure out a way to protect them. And if you show up to help, maybe they'll warm up to you!
Yaaaay! That'll work for sure! Tsu-chan and Taka-nii are so smart!
Whoa, whoa, wait! Maeko, calm down. Taka-kun, there's no way the villagers will accept us that easily. Even if we convince their elder, the two guards will never forgive us for our theft...
I firmly believe that it's better to try something and fail than to regret not having tried.
I mean, those girls will probably be upset, but maybe they would be more willing to listen to your story if we were to save the village.
It's better to try something and fail than regret not having tried? But won't you be sad if you fail despite having tried so hard?
Well, it will only hurt if I fail. Nothing is ever set in stone, so it never hurts to try!

While I was rather certain this idea would work, I knew I first had to convince the girls. With the amount of confidence my tone carried, I was hopeful that it was only a matter of time before Machiko would begin to consider it.
I am not so sure, Taka-kun. Do you really want to face the wrath of Miyo head on?
If it's for the sake of my friends, sure. And if we're lucky, she'll finally show that dere side of her.
I'm up for it! I want to play with the people in the village! I want to be able to eat the delicious smelling foods and learn all about them!
What about you, Machiko-san? Don't you want to be able to walk around without the constant fear of being chased down by angry villagers? This could be the only chance we have.
Hrrmph... I suppose, with both of you being so enthusiastic, I do not have much of a choice in the matter. It would be nice to be able to buy sake from the human world. Spirit sake is rather bland.
That's the spirit! We should hurry to the village, then.
Very well, Taka-kun.
Meanwhile in the village
The two guards, who had just returned from patrolling the area, found their village in uproar.
Chaos reigned supreme as villagers fled their homes, screaming about some monster that had appeared at the marketplace. Armed with their weapons, the two rushed off to deal with the threat.
Another attack so soon? First those crafty fox crooks sneak in, twice, and now THIS!? Hikage, report! What is it this time?
Several shop owners report seeing the same girl enter their shops, take food and eat it without paying. Afterwards, she seemed to turn see-through, and, uhm, melt away.
S-She was reported nearby, but I...
One? How can ONE girl cause this much havoc? Those useless guardsmen! Hikage, come with me, we will deal with this ONE girl ourselves!
Th-That, uh... I... don't know if I can...
What do you mea... Oh. A spirit. Right. Narumi, I need you to ensure that no one gets near. I'm trusting you with this.
Much to the relief of Narumi, the katana wielding girl approached a nearby shop, which had a crowd of people gathered around it.
Devious monster! Show yourself this instant! Surrender yourself and I might let you go free!
However, the moment she tried to enter the building, a large pink mass surged outwards, knocking her back onto the ground.
M-Miyo!
In the shadow of a nearby building, a figure could be seen rustling about.
Upon closer inspection, it turned out to be a girl, seemingly occupied downing several bottles of sake before she dropped them and turned to look at the person who had interrupted her.
When she finally moved into the light, it became clear that she wasn't a villager... but a girl covered in slime from head to toe!
I spilled that tasty drink because you surprised me... Now I'm a sad...
Wh... What the...
Ahem... You are not welcome here, spirit! You have caused chaos, and that tasty drink, as you said, was not yours. You are a thief, and a nuisance! Leave immediately!
I'm not a thief!
And what's a 'nuisance'? You're just trying to act like a smarty-pants because I don't know those fancy words.
Typical... It means you are a bother. You do not belong here.
Liar! The forest is my home, and this place is part of the forest. Therefore, I am not a thief. Everything in the forest belongs to me and my sisters. Including... you.
What do you mean? Don't try anything funny, spirit! I have fought against your kind before, and I still stand strong here today! HIKAGE! EVACUATE THE PEOPLE!
Seems like the human girl wants to play~
Do not belittle my ability to defend this village! HAAAH!

The girl lunged forward with her katana drawn and slashed through the spirit's body. However, the part that was sliced through sealed up almost as quickly, rendering the attack completely ineffective.
Haha, that tickles~

With the sword stuck inside the slime girl's body, the spirit quickly lashed forwards, spraying several jets of a slimy substance at the female guard, who soon discovered that her clothes began to melt away.
Let's see how confident you are without your sword...
And clothes~

Humming the last part with childish playfulness, the slime girl pushed the swordswoman down onto the grass, the slime that had been splattered onto her starting to harden, causing her to stick to the ground.
Ahh! What the... Let me go! Cheater! Devious fiend!
Hehe, you're the one who tried to use a sword against me.
Don't you know that girls like me can easily avoid such things? Besides, this way I can continue eating in peace~
Now, be a good girl and stay here while I grab some more yummies.
Nhhh... Never! I will not rest until you have been vanquished! Nnhh!! Damn you!
It's useless~ Once my slime hardens, a puny human like you won't be able to break out of it. Especially one who is powerless without a sharp stick.
I assure you, I am more than just a monkey with a sharp stick! You will never break my stamina! You will not make me silent! ARRRGGHHH!
Miyo struggled, clenching her fists in an effort to try and free herself. The slime cracked here and there, but nothing indicated that it was ready to yield.
Yes, yes~ You're a stuck monkey, but you're kind of loud... It's giving me a headache.
The slime girl playfully tapped her forehead as Miyo continued her desperate attempts to break free.

Just... answer me this. Why do you spirits target us? You could go anywhere. You could spend your days hidden deep within your forest, and yet you constantly attack us, constantly throw our lives around like they were NOTHING!

But... the forest is boring~ There isn't anyone around to play with aside from my sisters. You humans are such a curious bunch. But it's no fun when you all raise your swords, torches and pitchforks whenever we visit.
You know what else isn't fun? Having to rebuild our homes every time you visit! We do not want our lives ruined every time you're feeling bored and wish to 'play'.
We are not toys, you monster! We are humans, proud and wise. Strong beings with souls and minds! We will not stand by idly as you terrorize our people!
I'm not too sure about pride and strength... You do realize that, if it wasn't for my slime, you'd be giving the villagers a show they wouldn't soon forget, don't you?

A... Ah! Th-That's not... You're the one who... My clothes are... Th-That's not important right now! If it wasn't for this goo, I would still have my clothes on! Fiend! Monster! Bratty little... thing!!
Oh, so you want me to remove my slime? I guess you are kind of annoying, with your nagging and all. Maybe I need to punish you a bit.
The slime girl smiled mischievously at Miyo as the slime that covered the girl started to compress, almost painfully so.
Aaahhh!!! Th-This is... nothing compared to... what this village has... had to endure! Nnnhhhh!!!
I only came by to get some yummies. You're the one who decided to make a show out of it.
Y-You took... from many... shops... without... paying for it! Ahh!
Actually~ Maybe I should wrap you up in a cocoon and drag you back to my home. Then I won't have to visit the village to play with someone.
If... If that is what it takes. I would do anything to protect this village, and the people in it. If you promise me that you will not return to the village, then...
You aren't exactly in any position to make demands.
Stop! You can't go in there!
There they are! Maeko-chan, go! Use your magic!
Right!
The sound of running footsteps came from the crowd, when suddenly the slime girl felt her body growing warmer, small flame sparks seemingly floating around her body, causing her body to slowly melt.

At the same time, from amidst the crowd, three figures appeared to keep the slime girl from her prey. Two fox spirits, one muttering an incantation of sorts while the other was holding some sort of ritualistic staff.
Trailing behind them was the naginata wielding guard, accompanied by a young man.
Please, Narumi-san, we're trying to help. I don't want to have to stop you!
If you think you can save Miyo, then... okay. Just...
Just know that if any funny business goes down, I will chop your head clean off!
R-Right. I hope the girls know what they're doing...
Sakura! What are you doing here!?
YOU! FOX!
While the slime girl was being distracted by the fox spirits, I ran over to Miyo's side, using all my strength to pull at the slime that covered her.
However, all I seemed to manage was a slight tear. Freeing the girl was clearly going to take a while.
They're here to help, so use your energy for something useful, like getting rid of this damn slime!
Ah! Machiko, have you come to play, as well? Please... tell your sister to stop her spell. It feels... rather tingly.

Maeko, keep up the good work. No, Sakura, I have not come to play. You are a fool, a bubble brained moron! Why are you harassing the villagers? If you wanted food, you know you could have come to the mansion!
Meanie Machiko! You can't tell me what to do! Not to mention, the food from the village is tastier than the fruit at your place! Besides, I just wanted to play with them a bit...
But then they started screaming and this monkey girl, with her sharp stick, tried to scare me away.
I will not stand for these insults! Just you wait until I am free!
Onee-sama... the spell is almost done... If I keep going on, it might...
Just a little more, little one. Sakura, I do not wish for this to end this way. You know what will happen if Maeko's spell is allowed to continue.
You might get stuck in your midget form for a long time, and I am certain you do not want that.
Leave this village. Please.
Buuh~ You're going to melt me? That's unfair! My sisters won't be happy to hear Machiko and Maeko sided with the silly humans, when all I was doing was having some fun... I'll be back!
And with those words, the slime girl melted into a pool of water, and soon disappeared from sight.
Once the slime girl had disappeared from the village, I succeeded in tearing off the slime that covered Miyo.
However, as the slime shattered into millions of tiny pieces, Miyo was left without any form of cover, causing me to quickly cover my eyes.
D-DON'T YOU DARE LOOK AT ME!
Scrambling to her feet, the girl rushed away, most likely in search of a change of clothes.
With the slime girl gone, the villagers turned towards the fox spirits with confused gazes.
The tension in the air was thick. No one knew what to expect. Finally, a familiar figure emerged from within the crowd.
It's a pleasure to finally meet you again, Takahiro-kun, even if the circumstances could have been better...
What are you saying, Elder? That man is clearly in cahoots with the spirits!
Wait a second, these girls just wanted to help!
Onee-sama... my head hurts...
It's okay, dear. I'm here. Just hold onto me, tightly. I'll protect you, and so will Taka-kun.
It's a trap!
Silence! How dare you act with such hostility toward those who just saved your lives?
The crowd seemed rather startled by the firmness in the old man's voice but soon obeyed, some of them feeling rather ashamed all of a sudden.
It is clear that you and your companions did not come here with ill intentions, Takahiro-kun. I must ask you to forgive the people for their nervousness and hostility.
As you have most likely noticed, contact between the spirits and humans has been rather... problematic at best.
I understand their concern, but will you at least hear me out?
Very well, if that is what you desire, then it will be the least we can do for those who have helped save the village upon this day.
However, let us wait for the chief to return. I believe it will be important for her to hear what you have to say.
I-I'll go find her, ojii-sama!
Feeling grateful that the elder had granted me the chance to carry out my plan, we waited for Miyo to return.
Thankfully, the elder brought us somewhere private, where Machiko could tend to Maeko without the villagers looking on in contempt.
Uugh, how many times am I going to have to say it? I AM SORRY. I froze, okay? I panicked. Your sword is stronger than my naginata. What was I even going to accomplish by--
That is unacceptable! I will reprimand... What are THOSE creatures doing here? Elder-sama, this is highly unorthodox!
She's highly unorthodox.
Shhh, Maeko-chan!
These are our guests, Tsukino-dono. You shall treat them with the respect they deserve. Now, take a seat and listen to their tale. That is an order.
Hmph. I understand, Elder-sama.
First and foremost, let me express my gratitude for helping save this village.
While Tsukino-dono's brave attempt to stop the spirit allowed us to prevent further damage, I fear that her fate would have been much worse, had the spirit been allowed to continue its rampage.
Therefore, from the bottom of my heart, thank you for saving Tsukino-dono and this village, Takahiro-kun. And you, as well, fox spirits.
No problem! Tsu-chan told us to do it! Besides, Sakura's a stupid smelly meanypants!
We humbly accept your gratitude, Elder-sama.
Narumi-chan, Tsukino-dono...
Th-Thank you, Maeko-san, Chi-Cha... uh, Machiko-san. You really helped us out there. You've got more guts than me. That girl had me terrified!
Tch... Have you not considered that they might be working together with that monster, and that this is all just a ruse to sneak into the village and steal what little resources we have left?
The elder sighed before his gaze sharpened, his tone surprisingly stern in comparison to how he had just been talking. His voice was so harsh, that both girls visibly flinched at the sound of it.
Miyo... You seem to be underestimating the power of these spirits. If those three had joined forces, there would possibly have been no village left to defend.
The man sighed deeply, shaking his head before continuing.
You should be grateful. We would not stand a chance if all spirits were to conspire against us. Do I need to remind you that we can barely stand our ground against even one of them?

Elder-sama... You must understand, due to my situation, I simply cannot pretend to be friends with a spirit! Not after everything they have done to us. But, for now, I will at least remain silent on the matter.
There is more at stake here than my personal feud.
Know this, fox spirits. If I find either of you doing anything suspicious, I will personally find out whether my sword goes through you as ineffectively as it did that monster.
There shall be no talk of such things within this house!
Now, Takahiro-kun. You mentioned you wanted to tell us something.
Could it be related to your younger companion's comment? I find it curious to hear her mention the name of an old spirit such as Tsuyuri.
Actually, what I'm about to tell is something I learned directly from her.
You mean... you met her in person?!
I nodded my head firmly.
There's a reason behind the spirits' attitude towards humans. And doesn't it strike you as odd, that there are only spirits in this particular area?
It is true that there has been no spirit sightings outside of this region, but what does that have to do with us?
It has something to do with this region, apparently. You see, the spirits here aren't from this world.
You mean to say--
Taka-kun, what are you saying? We are spirits, but surely we are still of this world!
Onee-sama, what does that mean?
Tsuyuri told me you probably wouldn't remember it, because of how young you were when it happened.
But spirits have a world of their own. Some accident caused both worlds to merge temporarily.
Then, why aren't there more spirits around?
The whole thing was apparently dealt with before it got out of hand, but a few spirits became trapped here.
Machiko-san, Maeko-chan, and four other spirits were unfortunate enough to get stuck here. I think Tsuyuri willingly came here to watch over them.
You remember being with Tsuyuri for a while, don't you?
Ah! That's... That's none of your business!
Tsu-chan took care of us for a little while, but then she took us to the mansion and sort of just left us there. Now we can only visit her when she wants us to...
What about these four other spirits?
Even though she's a powerful spirit, Tsuyuri has to follow certain 'rules'.
Because of that, she wasn't able to reach the other spirits.
I-I do not know what to say. I need a moment. Might I use another room to compose myself?
I'll show you! I can take you somewhere. And, uh, look after you. To make sure you don't do anything fiendish and all that. Come on, Chi, uh, Machiko-san. This way.
When Machiko and Narumi left the room, I sighed and turned my focus back onto the conversation.
Now about the... ahem... panty theft.
Ah, right, they did seem rather adamant about getting their hands on those for some reason.
What was the purpose of that? Surely, those girls have undergarments of their own?
It was a simple mistake! I needed a maiden's silk for my spell! How was I supposed to know that it was something other than the silky things girls wear?
It was all a misunderstanding. None of them knew that 'maiden's silk' is another term for a wedding sash.
Innocent, huh... If they really thought that, they could have just used their own!
Nyaah, that's where you're wrong! Onee-sama and I don't have any!
Y-You two...
Ahem, I think we should move on to a different matter.
Y-Yeah! Moving on... Tsuyuri suggested that we find a way to help you guys out. If we can make you trust us, we figured that maybe you would make us the sash.
But why would you need such an item?
Buuu! Silly man! I already told you! I need it for a spell!
Maeko-chan, this guy isn't a magician. He doesn't know what you're talking about.
Basically, Maeko-chan has been researching a spell that would allow her to travel to another realm.
Why would she desire such a power?

Imagine being stuck, far away from this village. You don't have any way to return to your loved ones. To make matters worse, you're in a place you don't know, with beings unlike anything you have seen before.
Now, let's say you had a power that would let you to go anywhere you want. Where would you go?
Are you saying that--
Yes. Even if they weren't aware of it, they must have subconsciously felt they were different from you. They only wanted...
To go home...
... Home.
Um... kinda? I guess. I just want to cast the spell to see what would happen...
Tsu-chan told me that if I ever felt like that, I should ask her first, and go with it. So I did. And since she didn't warn me about anything, I figured it was just like any other spell.
I think it's normal, Maeko-chan. Whether it's humans or spirits, everyone wants a place they can call their own. A place where they are accepted for who they are. Isn't that right, Elder-sama?
But you accept me for who I am, don't you Taka-nii?
I would certainly feel sad if everyone ended up rejecting me simply because of who I am. Surely, not all spirits are good at heart, but perhaps we have been too quick in labelling them all evil.
For a moment, I saw the elder's eyes wander sideways towards the room Narumi and Machiko had moved to, and his gaze softened.
Unfortunately, some of us have suffered quite a lot at the hands of spirits. It will take time for people to come to terms with those feelings, Takahiro-kun.
Meanwhile, in a room off to the side of the main room, the guard lieutenant was watching over the older fox spirit as she seemed to be in the grips of a minor panic attack.
No, this can't be right, this can't be true, I-I'm from this world, THIS world. I belong here... don't I?
M-Maybe you should sit down, or, like, lay back or something? I can get you a pillow if you'd like, or...
No! You could not possibly understand. You cannot know what it is like, to have everything you knew, your whole life, just pulled out from under you, completely!
Actually, I do.
What do you mean?
It was a while ago now. I was still just a kid, maybe five years old. There was an incident involving those other spirits.

I don't know exactly what happened, but there was a big fire, and my parents got trapped inside. They never made it out. So, yeah, don't tell me I don't know what it's like to have your whole life torn apart!
I... I am sorry. I did not know. I could not have known...
That almost makes it worse... You should know. You should know exactly what it did to me, how it made me feel.
P-Pardon? I do not know what you are talking about, uh... Narumi, was it?
Naru-tan.
What...?

That's what you used to call me, Chi-chan. You used to call me Naru-tan. We used to play together almost every day! That's how you should know. I was with you when the incident happened! And you don't even remember!
I... nnghh... ahh...
The girl collapsed onto one knee, clutching her head.
Ahh... I... remember... the village glowing orange... A girl younger... resembling you... I... Why could I not remember this before! Ahhhh!!
Machi... ko?
My head hurts! I remember! I remember seeing you cry. You screamed for your parents, and then, you were calling out my name as I ran! I had to!

The villagers... they wanted to catch us. All spirits! They didn't care that we had been playing by the river all day. I couldn't explain it. I had to run! I-I can't believe it... Naru-tan, I am so, so sorry!
The fox spirit reached out for the guard, who pulled back instinctively. As she did, the pain seemed to disappear, and Machiko looked more relieved than anything.
I... no, not yet. I can't just forget about all that! It isn't that easy. But you did stand up to that slime creat... uh, the one you called Sakura.
You risked your life for Miyo, and for the village, and that's worth giving you a chance for. I can't promise a miracle, though, 'cause she barely even listens to me, but I'll try to talk her down.
She really isn't the cold, heartless captain everyone think she is.
Thank you! Thank you for giving us a chance, Naru-tan! I promise, Maeko and I will do our best. Perhaps you could tell me more, about the incident?
I'd rather not. It isn't a happy story. But if you do me a favor, I might be more willing to tell you more.
I want to get stronger! I couldn't do anything earlier today. I couldn't protect anyone. I don't have the brains for magic or anything like that, but that Takahiro guy knows some pretty flashy moves.
If you get him to teach me some, I'll tell you about what happened. Deal, Chi-chan?
I am not too sure. That seems like a bit of an unfair deal on my part. Perhaps you could sweeten it for me, just a little?
Always the charmer, huh? Alright, how about this: I'll tell you something about when we were younger. Like when we used to play together, in the woods near the village.

There's a little stream there that we used to fish in. Sometimes, you would sneak into the village with me, and we'd play pranks on the shop owners, knocking on doors and running away. Silly kid stuff!
You'd even show me your magic, your illusion abilities, but you said you didn't like doing it all that much, because it made Maeko cry...
That's right... When Maeko saw me transform for the first time, she got so scared she ran away and nearly hurt herself.
How could I possibly have forgotten that? Naru-tan, thank you for telling me that. I swear, I will get Taka-kun to help you. Thank you!
The girl stepped forward once again, this time wrapping her arms around the surprised guard, who did not pull back. As the two women hugged each other tightly, the fox spirit began trembling.
Hey, come now. We should probably get back to the others. They're probably wondering where we've gone!
Forgive me for my absence. I must admit, I did not expect such revelations. Taka-kun, have you explained the situation?
Yeah, I think they get it now. But it's probably going to take a while for the villagers to accept you.
I do believe it will be in everyone's best interest to see the true nature of the fox spirits.
While I can't promise that friendships will be forged today, let it be known that from now on the fox spirits are welcome in our village and will receive the same respect as any guest should.
Thank you, Elder-sama. My sister and I are very grateful for your hospitality.
However, the laws of this village shall apply to you three, as well.
Takahiro-kun, I believe it will be in your best interest to learn more about the village. Tsukino-dono, Narumi-chan... I leave him in your care.
And try not to put him back in that cell, you two.
You've got it, ojii-sama! We'll do our best! What about Maeko-chan and Chi-cha... uh, Machiko-san?
I would like them to stay here for the time being. We need to discuss what to do, should the other spirits choose to return.
Elder-sama, I would like to stay with you for that conversation. It is my duty to protect the village and those within it from any perceived danger. This includes you.
I also believe it would serve me well to hear this first-hand.
Of course, I expected nothing, Tsukino-dono. Narumi-chan, how about you take Takahiro-kun for a walk?
And do not think that this a date, young man. You are going to need more than that show earlier to earn the right to date my granddaughter!
The man laughed heartily as I blushed, smiling weakly. At least I wouldn't end up cuffed and brought to a jail cell this time. Maybe it would even turn out to be a pleasant experience.
It didn't. Even the elements seemed to be working against the village today. Barely a minute into the walk, the skies let loose and we were both soaked through within seconds.
Letting out a yelp, Narumi grabbed my hand, and pulled me towards the nearest shelter.
Oh, eww, eww, eww! A rainfall this suddenly. That's just typical! Today just went from bad to worse.
Heh, I thought it would take more than a bit of rain to douse your warrior spirit.
Pah, warrior spirit. Yeah, I really had that by the bucketful today, didn't I?
Hmm, you sound different from last time we met. I was practically expecting you to shout, 'Hah! If you want to stop the great Narumi, you better up your act, Mother Nature!'
'Send me a tsunami, an earthquake, or a tornado my way and you might just stand a chance!'

Yeah, well, that was before I realized what a weak, cowardly person I am. It wouldn't take all that to stop me. I'm not that great. I'm just a girl who's trying to impress someone. It just takes a drizzle to stop me...
I frowned for a moment, trying to think of how to respond. It looked like her inability to stop the slime girl from causing havoc, had led Narumi to feel like she had failed somehow.
It was then I recalled a certain scenario and decided to act.
I swiftly grabbed a hold of Narumi's shoulder while my other arm wrapped around her own, almost as though I was about to comfort her.
I had decided to use a judo technique. Pretending to be the hero of some manga, preparing himself for a secret technique, I shouted proudly.
Wha... Hey! Stop!
Tsurikomi goshi!

Having practiced judo since I was a kid, I easily spun the girl over my shoulder and onto her back in the rainy grass. My eyes were sharp as they looked down at her, repeating the words I remembered from a certain manga.
If you let one loss break your spirit, you're not suited for the life of a warrior! The stronger the people around you, the more you should improve! You--
That doesn't mean anything! You took me by surprise, is all! You looked like you were going to kiss me, and then you tossed me on my back!
I-I wasn't planning to kiss you! And now I forgot my heroic speech! Get up and grab your weapon, Narumi! If words won't cheer you up, then let's talk like warriors do: through battle!
Wait here!
The woman pushed herself upwards and barged past me, stomping into a nearby building. Only now did I recognize it as the building I had been held in the day before.
I waited under the wooden slats of the shelter as the rain continued. A few moments later, I heard a loud thud, and through the doors, Narumi burst.
In her hands she held a naginata, similar to the one she had used previously, but with a different blade.
In the moment before her attack landed, I noticed that it wasn't nearly as sharp as it should have been.
HYAAAH!
It took everything I had to raise my arms in time and grab a hold of the shaft of the weapon before the attack crushed my body. Pushing her weapon aside, I darted forwards.
Pushing my hand forcefully against her chest, I attempted to open her up for a second attack.
That's it! You're not some of weak-willed girl, who is going to lose her fighting spirit that easily!
Shut up! You don't even know what's going on! I'm going to beat the snot out of you, and THAT'LL make me feel better!
Didn't you forget one of the most important things in a fight?
The woman gritted her teeth and lunged towards me again, a wild, angry strike that would have been ridiculously easy to dodge had she not been so fast.
Even though I was faster, the 'whoosh' that shot past me made it clear she was not pulling her punches.
I don't care! It's not important! I couldn't do it! I got scared! I let everyone down!

And that's why you failed as a warrior. I can read every emotion behind your attacks. You're angry at yourself for being unable to stop that spirit, right? Disappointed at yourself for lacking the courage to face them.
But you're not some lone hero who has to do everything by herself!
I quickly pushed her naginata upwards, a quick slide of my body nearly knocking the weapon out of her hands. I quickly raised a hand to flick her forehead before stepping backwards.
Did anyone tell you that you had to fight that spirit on your own? Did you forget that you have friends out there that would give their lives to help you?
A hero who fights alone is a hero who dies early! It's why both you and the Tsundere Tyrant weren't able to defeat that spirit!
HOW!? How am I supposed to fight by her side, when she's so much better than I can ever hope to be? How can I stand a chance against spirits when I'm just a girl with a sharp stick?
Miyo lost her sword, but she never lost her resolve. I lost mine as soon as things became dangerous. I'm worthless!
The woman snarled as her forehead was flicked, and she quickly lunged forwards again, lashing out with her spare hand, aiming for my temple.
I ducked, slid back, and narrowly dodged the swing of her naginata. I noticed a change in her stance, which seems to allow a closer range attacking style.
The only limits we have, are those we impose upon ourselves. If she's better than you, you just need to keep improving.
Even I have things I want to overcome! That's the thing about martial arts. Why haven't you tried talking to her about this?
Because I can't! I can't talk to her, I just need to... be strong. She does it without relying on anyone, without bending or yielding. I can't do it, I can't be like her!
Is that really how it is? Maybe you just don't know what the source of her strength is. But in your case, it's just a matter of finding your resolve.
Well, there's the problem! I don't have any! I'm just a dumb little girl who needs to be saved all the time!
Come on, stop talking like that. Don't you have something you want to protect at all cost?
Nothing at all? Not your family, your friends, your village? You just turn up for the paycheck, and tell them 'thanks'?
You're right... there's nothing. I lost everything.
The woman's next attack caught me by surprise. She flung her weapon towards me at full strength, hitting my arm, and causing me to flinch. As she turned away from me, she slipped on the wet grass.
Before I had a chance to react, she scrambled to her feet and suddenly took off towards the forest.
I chased the girl as fast as I could, barely able to keep up as she picked her way through the trees. She finally slowed down, coming to a stop at the edge of a small clearing.
Huff... You're... really fast... Why did you... run?
Damn it, why did you follow me? I didn't ask you to come. I don't want you here. Leave!
I'm can't do that, Narumi-chan. A hero never abandons someone in need, and a master never lets his pupil down.
What are you talking about?
It's not important. Won't you at least tell me what has gotten you this worked up?
I know you panicked back when the wild spirit attacked, but I think most people would have. It's not something you need to feel ashamed of.

No answer came from the girl, who kept her gaze lowered. Rolling my eyes, I turned to leave, but stopped when I noticed two small graves. They looked old but well maintained, sitting in the shade of a tree.
Narumi...
My parents... lost their lives during a spirit attack. I was lucky enough not to see it happen first-hand, but I'm all alone now. I lost my best friend, too.
When I saw Miyo trapped, I got so scared that I was going to lose her too... I just kinda shut down. My mind went blank.
I envy you, Takahiro. You're trapped in another world, and you might never see your family and friends again, but here you are, still so positive and so eager to help everyone. How do you do it?
Well, I do worry about whether I'll be able to return to my world or not... But I realized that just sitting around, sulking all day, won't get me anywhere. I'd rather spend my time helping everyone.

But I don't think you lost everything that day. I mean, the Tsun... Uh, I mean, Miyo-san is still here, right? So, maybe she can be the reason for you to get stronger. And what about the elder and the other villagers?
Isn't their trust in you enough of a reason to fight?
It's... It's just so hard... I'm so weak! I can't fight. But you can! Will you help me? I need to get better. And your skills are incredible!
If I get strong enough, maybe I can finally protect those I care about. Miyo-san, Chi-chan, the village...
Well, I'm going to be stuck here for a while anyway, so I wouldn't mind helping you out. But...
If you had kept your emotions in check during our fight, I would have been seeing stars by now. But who's Chi-chan? You're not talking about the elder... are you?
Oops! I wasn't supposed to say that! Can I trust you, Takahiro-kun?
Of course! My lips are sealed.
Ah! Um... C-Chi-chan... is... Machiko...
Oh, you already gave her a nickname?

It's a little complicated. We were friends when we were kids. She was the friend I lost... After the incident, the villagers went on a witch hunt and got rid of all the spirits, banishing them to the forest.
I haven't spoken to her since. That is, until today.
I doubt Machiko-san has changed much from how you remember her. Well, aside from the fact that she might not have been such a tease...
Hehe, nope. She was actually a tease back then, too. Only, not so... um... intense.
She used to play fun little pranks, like hiding a bucket of water on a door or hiding a frog in someone's boot! It was so much fun!
I genuinely hope the next generation of children in this village won't take after the two of you.
Bah, you're no fun! It's only a bit of harmless silliness. We made sure no one ever got hurt. We even rescued the frogs! It's... It's just a shame it all ended so quickly...
Why don't you try to reconnect with her now that she's allowed back into the village?
I'd like to. We had a lot of fun when we were playing, but... something seemed weird when I spoke to her earlier.
She didn't seem to remember anything. And it looked like it hurt when she tried to. It's probably nothing, but you never know.
Maybe something happened to her after she ran away?
In any case, I think we should return to the village. This rain... Oh, wait! The rain stopped! I didn't even notice! We should still get back, though. That, and, umm...
I turned my gaze away, my cheeks burning as I pointed at her chest.
Your clothes are soaked.
Ah! You're right! Haha, yeah, they're almost see through!
T-That's not something you should be amused about!
Look who's talking! My body is fantastic, and it deserves to be shown off!
I doubt your grandfather wants you showing it off to anyone at all, let alone a guy! Anyway, let's get back to the village before you catch a cold!
The girl nodded, and with one last look at the two graves, she turned, and began to walk back to the village, with me following in her trail.
We walked back to the village, exchanging idle chatter. I managed to establish that, while the girl was training her body well, she lacked discipline.
She led me to an unfamiliar building on the outskirts of the village, and quickly unlocked the door.
Welcome to my humble abode. It doesn't look like much, but I keep it tidy. You can put on one of ojii-sama's old robes if you want to. You know, while your stuff dries!

This used to be his place before he became the village elder. I never really got rid of all of his things. He won't even notice you're wearing his stuff. You can change in there. I'll get into something else.
Before we had a chance to get started, the sound of heavy footsteps could be heard from outside, and soon enough a young guardsman appeared at the door.
Hikage-san. There you are. We have been searching for you! Elder-sama wishes to see you right away!
Oh! Of course, right away!
The guard saluted, snapped around, and took off. Narumi closed the door behind him, and walked back to a clean pile of clothes.
Without warning, she began stripping off her clothes in front of me!
My first reaction was to quickly cover my eyes with one of my hands. Narumi, however, didn't seem the least bit bothered by my presence!
N-N-Narumi-chan?! W-What are you doing?!
Hehe, what's the matter, Takahiro? Never seen a girl in her undies before? Oh, wait, you saw mine yesterday! Maybe you've just never seen them on a girl.
A-Actually, I've seen a lot of things in my life...
But never a girl stripping! What would your grandfather say if he saw y-y-you?
I stuttered as I briefly visualized how Narumi would have looked without the underwear, but quickly cleared the thought from my mind.
Well, he's not going to find out, is he? It's nothing. We need to hurry, right? So get changed, already!
It's a matter of decency! Aren't you embarrassed knowing there's a healthy guy in the same room as you? At this rate, this and that might happen, and we're going to be late either way!
Not really. I don't mind it if it's you, Takahiro-kun.
I'm honored--
I wouldn't mind any of my friends seeing me like this. Miyo has seen me naked lots of times!
That's not really the issue here! Anyway!
I quickly turned around, trying my best not to peek as she finished changing.
Tell me when you're done. This kind of stimulation isn't any good for my mind...
If you'd quit your babbling, we'd be done already! Get your clothes OFF and the dry ones ON!

I suddenly felt hands grab my hips from behind, and without any other warning, my trousers were yanked down to my ankles. A firm kick to my rear followed, and I stumbled forwards, towards the wardrobe.
Now!
You didn't have to kick me...
I sighed in frustration. I had been wrong. Whether it was the Tsundere Tyrant, Narumi, Machiko, or Maeko... These girls had no common sense.
You know, it's not fair that only you get a show!
H-Hey, keep your eyes to yourself! This isn't a peeping contest.
Good thing, too. I'd have no chance of winning!
Well... I admit your side certainly has the more interesting view...
I mumbled as I snuck another peek at Narumi while putting on the old robes that I had found in the wardrobe.
She seemed to have changed most of her clothes by now, replacing them with near identical dry ones. I wondered why she would have more than one set of the same clothes, when it struck me.
You have a strange dresscode here.
Huh? What dresscode? These are my clothes... Are you saying I dress strangely?
No! They just look a lot like your other clothes. Then again, what do I know?

There's not a lot of options when it comes to clothes here. In the cities, maybe, but here, you find something you look good in, and you stick to it. Some folks don't even have spare clothes, so I'm pretty lucky.
Hmm, I guess it would be for a tailor to find work in a small village like this. I'm guessing fabric isn't easy to come by, either...
Yeah. It's never been easy. But these days it's almost impossible to convince people to come here with the spirits around.
People used to pay a visit to the shrine, but lately they haven't been coming.
Makes sense. I don't think many would be willing to risk their lives, peddling goods to some small village, knowing wild spirits might attack.
Yeah. Oh, dang it... I'm going to need some help here Takahiro-kun. Are you done yet?
Yep, I just finished. What do you need help with?
My wrap came loose. Can you pull it back and tighten it for me? I've never been able to get it right on my own.
As she said that, she pulled her top up, presenting her back to me.
Y-You want me to do it?
Feeling slightly embarrassed at the thought, I tried my best to keep my thoughts pure as I took hold of the end of the wraps and helped pull them back, tying them into place.
I quickly made sure they were neither too tight nor too loose.
Come on, be a man. Just pull it tight and tie it!
A little surprised at her reaction, I decided to do as she said and pulled it even tighter than I had previously, securing it with a sigh.
T-This isn't good for my heart...
There, that wasn't so hard. Come on, let's hurry. Ohh, you look good. Like a handsome young businessman!
I look more like a monk than a businessman.
Smiling weakly, I quickly followed after Narumi who was already in a hurry to leave the house.
We dashed across the village to the elder's house, Narumi grabbing a weapon along the way. When we got there, we heard shouting, and exchanged worried glances before pushing through the door.
HALT VILLAIN! Ah... Oh my!
Prepare your... Oh... Umm, did we cross into a different dimension?
Aaahhhh!! Ahahahahaha! Stoppit, stoppit, stoppit!
Never! I'm going to vanquish you!
The scene that lay before us was unlike anything I had ever seen. In one corner, Maeko was cuddling a large, empty bottle, sleeping, and giggling to herself.

At the back of the room, the village elder was hitting a large casket with a lock on it while grumbling to himself. In the center of the room, Machiko lay pinned to the floor by Miyo, who was tickling her mercilessly.
Naru-chin! Naru-chin, help me with this! The chest is locked, and all the sake is trapped inside, and suffocating. We need to rescue it immediately!
Oh geez... They're drunk. Takahiro-kun, can you stop those two?
This wasn't the battle I was expecting...
I nodded my head in confirmation to Narumi's request and I turned towards the two girls on the floor, trying to decide how best to deal with them.
With both of them drunk, it would probably have been easy enough to get Miyo to release Machiko.
But before I had a chance to intervene, the two girls' roughhousing on the floor cased them to bump into the table, knocking over a bottle of sake onto the both of them.
Aww, I'm all wet now! You spilled the sake! Waaah, stupiiiiid!
The girl pushed herself upright, flailing like a spoiled child before turning tail and running through the door.
Good grief, who knows what she might do! Naru-chan, please go get her. In this state, she'd only make stupid advances at me.
Right!
As Narumi ran off to retrieve the drunken fox girl, I was left to take care of the remaining few.
Miyo-san. You need to come with me. We need to get you into something clean.
Hehehe, you just want to see me naked!
Wh-What?! No! I am not a pervert! Why does everyone seem to think that?! I mean, I DO want to see boobs, but I have my honor, damn it!
Hehe! Nope, I'm not going to do anything you tell me to. I'll stay right here and swim in sake!
I sighed and looked down at the woman who was indeed trying to swim in the tiny puddle of sake on the floor. Taking a deep breath, I prepared myself.
Tsundere Chief! Enemies have been sighted near the hot springs! Their numbers are about to overwhelm us! We need reinforcements right away!
I came up with the bluff on the spot, hoping it would get Miyo out of the room.
What!? We have to vanquish them at once! Come on, private pervert! To the hot springs!
But aren't we supposed to defend--
Before I had time to finish my sentence, Miyo had me dragged to the entrance of the building by the collar of my robe.
No! Attack, attack! Get to the hot springs and attack! I'll be there soon!

And with that, she shoved me through the door with a hefty kick, the doors slamming shut behind me. My hearing wasn't perfect, but I could've sworn I heard a yelp and a tumble following Miyo's departure.
A large open area lay ahead of me, closed off by a tall bamboo fence. There was also a small area off to the side for more delicate washing.
Sighing to myself, I began to tidy up the place a little, removing sharp objects and small obstacles that the drunken woman might injure herself with, and waited.
Five minutes went by before I heard the door open and close, followed by the gentle slosh of someone stepping into the water of the hot spring.
Ahhh, the water's great! Hurry up and get in!
Wha... Whatever happened to 'attack, attack'?
I turned around, expecting her to be standing in the water, with her clothes on.
However, the sight that awaited me was far from what I would have expected from the Tsundere Tyrant. There was no katana slicing through the air or any harsh words being shouted.
Instead, an attractive looking girl wearing a simple towel, had decided to take a seat in the hot water.
M-Miyo-san?
Whether it was the result of the drinking or not, the warm smile she showed me caused me to pause.
Care to join me?
I-I don't think--
Uugh, get in the water!
Y-Yes ma'am!
I quickly moved closer to the water, nearly slipping on the wet tiles before I made my way in. I folded up my robe, but kept the towel I had found around my waist.
Today's been pretty busy, huh? Though, the last thing I expected was for all of you to gulp down sake like a baby drinks its milk!
The girl said nothing for a while, regarding me with a faint grin on her face. It made me nervous. I would almost rather have her shouting and angry.
You don't slack off, do you. I can tell that you train a lot.
Huh?
Briefly caught off guard by her comment, I quickly gathered my thoughts and nodded in return.

Well, I practice judo, so it's natural for me to train my body a lot. I'm sure the same can be said of you, Miyo-san. I mean, you look, umm... rather feminine, but I could tell you knew how to handle a sword.
That shows diligence and talent, but above all, experience. You started young, didn't you?
I did.
She leaned back against the rocks and let out a sigh.
It took me a long time to become competent with a blade. Days and nights of endless training, regardless of wind and weather, all in order to toughen myself up, to make myself strong enough.
It is horrible, knowing nothing of your early life. I just turned up here, in rags. The guards found me out in the woods one day, while on patrol, starving and dirty.
The previous village elder took pity on me, and took me in.
Everything went well for a while. Narumi's family took me in, treated me like one of their own.
Then, everything fell apart. Seeing the village that had taken me in, fed me, clothed me, given me shelter, suffering at the hands of spirits... I couldn't take it.
As she spoke, she let out another sigh. It seemed the alcohol was making her a bit more talkative than usual, which wasn't a bad thing.
I just hoped I wouldn't end up paying for it once she had sobered up.
After that, I felt like I had to do something. I couldn't just sit by while everything fell apart around me.
The village was devastated by the fires. On that day. I pleaded with the former chief of the guard to train me, to make me stronger. I wanted to protect the village, to protect Narumi, at any cost!
He eventually agreed, but told me that I would need to strengthen my resolve first.
And that's why you became a... uh...
You can say it.
A Tsundere Tyrant?
I don't know what 'tsundere' means, but the tyrant part isn't far off... I didn't want to drive everyone away, least of all Narumi.
But I had to. In order not to feel the pain of loss again. Spirits haven't been our only problem. Bandits, beasts, and the weather...
The village needed protecting from all of it. It became a purpose, and it made me distance myself from everyone else.
I guess that explains why you've been acting like that around Machiko and Maeko.
That's right. Although... I am beginning to think that perhaps we can coexist. The fox spirits, at least. I suppose this has something to do with you, so, uh... thank you.
Um... You're welcome. It's not like I did much...
I mean it. Truly. You and the sisters. You may have saved me a life of living in fear, perhaps even prevented my death.
I think you better tell them that.
You're right. Especially considering what comes next...
Huh? What do you mean?
The girl's words were becoming incoherent, muttering something about spirits and the village. It seemed like fatigue was finally taking its toll.
Hmm, well, the other spirits probably won't be leaving the village alone anytime soon. We're going to have to figure out how to stop them.
But, asking Maeko-chan and Machiko-san to help us is like asking you to turn on Narumi-chan.
Hahaha, turn on!
The girl giggled at this for quite some time, so I let out a sigh, and coughed politely.
What I MEANT was, they'll have to fight against their own kind at some point.
I mean, why would they want to help you guys out in the first place? I think you and Narumi-chan will be the pieces we need to solve this puzzle.
And we better figure out what to do soon. I doubt those spirits will hold back next time.
You sound like it's some kind of game... That's not nice...
As she said this, the girl slid further down into the water.
It's a bit easier to think of it like that. The moment they get ahead of us, it's game over. If you and Narumi-chan fix things between the villagers and the sisters, things might work out.
You'll have to get as close to them as possible!
Ah! B-B-But I... I don't like girls like that!
The girl became incredibly flustered by my comment, having misunderstood what I had said. Before I could explain, she slumped over, her cheeks a deep crimson red.
As I tried to move closer, it became clear that she had passed out. The heat had probably gotten to her.
Just my luck. She had to pass out, wearing nothing but a towel. I swear, someone up there is testing my patience with all these temptations.
Sighing in annoyance, I carefully wrapped my arms around the girl, and pulled her out of the water.
Realizing that leaving Miyo here would be a bad idea, I thought about what to do when Narumi came barging in.
Takahiro-kun, I heard you were in here. I managed to... WHOA! What's going on here?
It's not what you think! The great captain couldn't handle the heat. Could you take over here?

Hehehe, sure, that's what happened. I believe you, you stud! Come on, I'll take her. I'll make sure she gets a good night's rest. But if you did do stuff to her while she was drunk, she's going to kick your ass!
I-I shall refrain from provoking her wrath. The last thing I need is a hungover samurai, trying to turn me into shish kebab.
I motioned for Narumi to come over.
You should get some rest too, Takahiro-kun. And make sure you keep an eye on Chi-chan. She's a little restless right now.
Leave her to me. She'll be in good hands.
And with those words, I left Narumi to take care of the passed out captain.
I quickly changed into the robes I had borrowed, and made my way back to the main hall. As expected, I found Machiko curled up on the floor.
Thankfully, it looked like she had made her way to Maeko, and was cuddled up next to her.
The two girls looked adorable, and their cute mumblings only made it all the more enjoyable to watch.
I considered waking them up, so we could return to the mansion, but the sound of my name interrupted my train of thoughts.
Walking out into the garden beyond the room, onto the wooden deck, I found the village elder sitting on the grass, looking up at the stars.
Young man... are the stars here as beautiful in your world?
I walked over to him, and lay down flat against the grass, finally allowing myself a rest. I looked up at the night sky and smiled.
You know, I never really got a good look at them. I'm always busy with this or that.
I yawned loudly and felt my eyelids getting heavy as I wiggled around a bit in an effort to get comfortable.
Perhaps you should. If you get back, that is. The previous elder once told me that all worlds shared the same sky. It sounded silly to me, but maybe there's something to it.
Mmmh... I mean, it does look similar. Sparkly and black. Maybe he was right.
The elder remained silent for a while. When he spoke again, I could barely make out what he said, sleepiness taking over. Before long, I drifted off to sleep, beneath that starry sky.
How long do you think he's been out here?
Must have been a while. His clothes are soaked with morning dew.
As I drifted back into consciousness, I heard Narumi and Miyo talking nearby. Their voices sounded hushed, as though they were far away.
I briefly considered jumping up and scaring them, but my body was not going to let me.
Maybe you should poke him?
Hikage, there is no need for that. Takahiro-san, wake up, you lazy slob!
I groaned as my eyes finally opened, the early rays of the rising sun making me raise a hand to conceal my eyes from the bright light.
I was usually quite the morning person, but having fallen asleep under the starry sky, I wasn't exactly in familiar surroundings.
Did the valkyrie come to take me off to Valhalla?
Heh, he's talking gibberish!
Do you intend to lie around all morning, or do you plan on being useful?
They're warrior angels, who come down from the heavens to pick up the souls of fallen warriors who have fought heroic battles. Not that I plan on dying anytime soon.
Hmph! You are no warrior. And neither is Narumi. Did you become an even bigger idiot overnight?
Ah...
This is exactly why I need to train you BOTH. None of you are warriors yet, but with my help, you will both become fine, noble warriors, capable of handling anything!
I liked her more when she was drunk.
It will be an honor to learn from you, sensei!
Yes ma'am! Maybe Takahiro-kun could teach both of us some of his moves! Heehee!
An excellent suggestion, Narumi. I believe he is a competent fighter, and learning more than simply how to use a weapon, but to fight without one too, would be a very convenient skill to have.
However! Work cannot begin like this. You need to get changed, eat, and wake up. Get to it!
But the grass is kind of soft here, and the view is pretty nice...
Yeah, but if we leave, these mountains will disappear!
That's a convincing argument, Narumi-chan. But I wonder... Which mountain would be the most difficult to climb? Mount Miyo or Mount Narumi?
Enough of this idiotic banter, you... you... bumbling buffoon of a boy!
Miyo-sensei, can I ask you something?
What is it?
We've been overwhelmed by the power of your 'tsun'. Could you please bless us with your 'dere' once in a while? You'd like that too, wouldn't you, Narumi-chan?
You might need to explain that... I... I don't really know what that means. Sorry, Takahiro-kun.
Nevermind. Don't worry about it.
I'm just saying, she should be less of a meanypants and show us a bit love and affection. What happened to motivating your troops?!
'Meanypants'?! Will you stop making such ridiculous comments! I ought to slap some respect into you!
Hehe! Angry Miyo!
I kind of miss the Miyo I saw at the hot springs yesterday...
Th... That was something completely unrelated! You don't know what you're talking about. Stop saying such embarrassing things! Geez!
A personality disorder?!
What?! As if one was bad enough, you're saying we've got TWO Miyo's wandering around?!
Just wait, Narumi-chan. Soon we'll have a whole army of Miyo's!
Stop it! Stop it, shut up both of you, right this instant! THIS IS GETTING RIDICULOUS!
The girl, who was now blushing brightly, turned her back to me and stormed off with a huff, her arms crossed indignantly.
Hehe~ I guess I better get up before she decides to return and kick me into gear. Thanks for wake up call, Narumi-chan.
After apologizing to Miyo, explaining that it was merely a joke, the girl had decided that she wanted to train each of us personally.
We both waited for Miyo to show up for the first part of the program, which was to take place in the town square.
It reminded me of a training camp at the dojo, although I had the feeling that this was about to turn out to be more fun.
As we waited, I noticed that preparations were being made for what looked like a festival.
I asked Narumi about it, and she told me that it was an annual celebration, happening a few days from now. As we chatted, Miyo turned up, sword in hand and a faint smirk upon her face.
Perfect. It seems like you're ready. If there is something every warrior needs, it's strength and discipline. With this in mind... let us start with running laps around the village!
Ohhhh, no, not laps!
That's all?
Yes, and those who slack off will be punished! Now, run!
Without any warning, Miyo drew her sword and pointed it at the two of us. Cringing, Narumi tugged at my arm, making it clear that our teacher wasn't joking.
Let's get down to it, shall we!
Oh no... She's enjoying this far too much...
We will defeat those spirits!
Oh boy...
Quit your yapping, and get to running! Unless you're eager to feel the edge of my sword!
Uuugh, yeah, she's totally enjoying. Come on, Takahiro-kun, let's get going. She's not going to be reasoned with like this.
She's a freaking drill sergeant...!
As I started to run alongside Narumi, I decided to finally take the exercise seriously. All things considered, I was surprised at the pace Narumi was running at.
Even though I felt like I could brag a bit about my own physical strength, her stamina was clearly superior to mine. After several hours of running, I found myself on my back.
My breathing was ragged and heavy, while Narumi was still standing upright, although visibly exhausted, judging from her panting.
Miyo had also been keeping up with us, and while she was panting too, she still looked fit to fight and ready to go.
D-Do you do this every day?
Not every day, no. Otherwise, we would not get no patrolling done. But I cannot fault you for your spirit. You both did well.
That was... harder than... anything we've ever done before...
I wouldn't be surprised if Miyo-san ends up being the final boss some day. Your strength and stamina are clearly beyond human capabilities.
Clearly! Maybe she's some kind of spirit, here to be mean to us on a superhuman level!
Narumi, how would you like to run ten more laps around the village?
Ah! No! I'm sorry, great Miyo! Please forgive me! I was just kidding!
You think we'll be allowed a break, if we pray to the almighty guardian spirit of this village?
I eyed Miyo as I attempted to hold back my smile, clapping my hands together in a prayer. Narumi giggled and followed my example.
Oh, mighty Miyo-sama! You, who watch over this village, please bless us with a short break! And maybe a lot of money and a beautiful wife, and--
Okay, a break is fine.
You two idiots want a break that badly? Fine, I have an idea. Elder-sama needs his baths cleaned. That ought to loosen you up for the next part of the training!
You hear that, Narumi-chan? We get to play at the hot springs!
Yaaay!
Clapping my hands one final time, I took Narumi and Miyo's hands by surprise, and dragged the two girls toward the village elder's house.
Ahh! Wh-What are you doing? Let go of me, right this instant!
Miyo-san, it won't do you any good to be serious like that all the time! Let's have some fun!
The three of us quickly reached the hot springs, and were soon preparing to begin our work.
However, it didn't take long for the somewhat serious cleaning work to turn into a series of silly games as I started chasing Narumi around with a soap soaked sponge, shouting in a nefarious tone.
I'm the soap monster! Prepare to be washed, foolish warrior!
Ahhh! No! The evil soap spirit has appeared! Do not fear, citizens of Hot Spring Village! Hyah!
The girl grabbed her mop and thrust it forwards, brandishing it like Miyo would have her katana.
I am the village's protector, Tsunderino Miyo! I will vanquish all who oppose me!
Will you two stop messing around? We have work to do!
It's the dreadful Miyo, nemesis of all spirits. Today is the day you fall!
Hyaah! Never! I will defend this place until my last breath! Hah!
Brandishing her mop in a candid fashion, she clearly didn't mean to do any real harm. Using my sponges, I batted it away with ease.
Then today shall be your last!
I told you to knock it off!
I laughed menacingly when a playful push from Narumi caught me off guard. I staggered backwards, my foot slipping on a bar of soap.
With a startled yelp of surprise, I felt myself topple over backwards, bumping into Miyo.

As I lost my balance completely, I let go of the sponge, sending it flying towards Narumi, who caught it on the face. I moved forwards to apologize to the woman, when, from behind me, I heard a yelp, and a loud splash.
Uh oh...
I... don't want to look... do I?
As I slowly turned around, my fears seemed to have been confirmed. Pulling herself from the water was Miyo, soaked from head to toe.
The anger that radiated off of her made her look like the devil himself.
You two...
I'm sorry! I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sorry! It was Takahiro-kun's fault! He started it!
Traitor! You can't blame me for--
My eyes caught sight of Miyo's clothes, which I finally noticed had turned see-through.
I bet he did it, so he could see you soaking wet like last night!
T-That wasn't part of the plan!
What... plan?
He's joking! It was just a joke! Seriously, Takahiro-kun and I were just playing around! It was an accident! Please forgive us!
Y-Yeah, you should forgive us. We were just having a bit of fun! We didn't mean to have it turn out like this.
H-He's right!
I told you both not to play around. I told you both to keep working. Hikage, I will deal with you later. Leave! Takahiro, you need to be punished now!
What? That's not fair! It was an accident!
It was an honor to have fought alongside you, Narumi-chan. My will has not yet been written, but I leave all of my belongings to anyone who wants it.
I'm not leaving. If you're going to punish him, punish me too! Besides, I bet you're only doing this because you want to spend more time with him!
WHAT!? Tha-That's ridiculous! What ever gave you that idea? I d-don't even l-like him! Besides, you're the one spending too much time with him!
H-Hold on, what are you talking about?
Hah! You admit it. You're jealous because I get to spend more time with him than you. Busted!
Th-That's complete nonsense! I just want to spar with him! Shut up, Narumi! Takahiro, prepare yourself! We are going to spar, right now! WITHOUT Narumi and her big butt interrupting us!
Hey! Now I KNOW you're jealous! My figure is divine!
Spar? Right here? Right now? But you're soaked!
A warrior should not worry about such things. Battles can be fought in the lashing rain or beneath the burning sun. But they must be fought!
Pfft, she just wants to show off her goods!
I'm going to regret this...
I sighed deeply as I took on a combative stance, certain that something was going to end up going wrong.
Soaked as she was, fighting against me, someone who uses grapples and throws? She was practically asking for trouble.

This is a perfect opportunity. Sometimes, your greatest strength can become your own worst enemy. Get in here, Takahiro! We will spar like this, knee-deep in water. This will be a fine test of your skills!
The girl made her way to the edge of the water, and grabbed a discarded mop.

It took a lot of willpower not to glance at her soaked figure as her clothes clung to her body. I eventually made it into the water, taking a defensive stance as she moved back towards the center of the pool.
Narumi! If you interfere, I will inform Elder-sama of the fate of his dearly beloved old teddy bear. The one you used as a...
LALALALA! NO ONE HAS TO HEAR ANYTHING! Fine! I'll stay put! You'll need someone to haul your body from the water once Takahiro-kun's done with you, anyway...
Isn't that blackmail?!
Oh, it is blackmail, alright. Now... prepare yourself!
The attack came a lot faster than I had anticipated. The wooden shaft aimed squarely at my midsection and hit me straight and hard, knocking me back a few steps.

I hissed as the pain of the impact spread, flexing my arms out. Miyo sloshed forwards, waves of water splashing aside as she stomped onward. I pushed myself upwards, dodging another strike to my left.
Go, go, Takahiro-kun!
I moved in closer, trying to make her thrusts less effective thanks to the length of the mop handle, and aimed a blow towards her shoulder. To my surprise, she took the hit without moving an inch.
If you are not going to put everything you have into this, you might as well stop calling yourself a man.
My eyes narrowed a little, and I pulled back as a wide strike sought to slam into my side.
Growling, I felt my anger flare. I quickly lashed out, smacking the mop handle away forcefully, and used the opportunity to get close once more.
I managed to land a few jabs against her midsection and one to her shoulder, before darting backwards as best I could in the water.
She appeared winded for a moment or two, before she spun the mop in her hands, pushing forwards again.
Takahiro-kun! Takahiro-kun! Takahiro-kun!
Her next strike was a downward slash, which I caught between my hands. With a grin, I pulled hard on the stick and flung my foot upwards in an attempt to land a kick.
She did the only sensible thing and let go of the mop, which let me toss it aside with ease.
A swordswoman without a sword can't hope to beat an experienced martial artist. This match is lost. Surrender.
Hmph. I suppose I have no choice.
As soon as she had said that, she spun around, lashing her leg upwards in a round-house kick that caught my jaw, knocking me back, and almost landing me on my rear.
Overconfidence gets you killed. The fight isn't over until your opponent is down!
She stood in front of me, her fists raised in a stance I did not recognize. If she was quicker without a weapon than with, I didn't stand a chance of beating her.
Her kicks were powerful, as the ache in my jaw reminded me, and she had plenty of stamina to go off of. The only way I could stop her, was to use... that.
That's not the only way to win a fight, you know.
I stepped forward, purposefully. I didn't need to attack her, just to get close. A few steps, and I had her right where I needed her, cornered and unable to get past me.
I took another step, and she darted to one side, trying to get past my blockade. I looped an arm around her waist, and braced myself for the counter attack I knew would follow.
My left leg applied pressure against her knees, sending her down onto them, while my other arm grabbed her arms high above her head, my weight pressed against her body.
No!
Yaaay! Takahiro-kun used the submission hold!

I held her tightly, but not enough to cause pain. All I had to do, was to lower my right hand, which in return would put pressure on her body. I did so, slowly, showing her just what she was up against.
Do you give up?
Ahhh! F-F-Fine. You win.
I grinned widely, chuckling to myself. I slowly helped her to her feet, gradually releasing my hold.
Try not to struggle when I release you. Otherwise...
But it was too late. Before I had a chance to warn her about the problem with that particular hold, she pulled away from my grip.
The angle of her arms, and the tightness of my arm around her waist, caused her clothes to tighten as she pulled away.
Blood circulation had a tendency of getting cut off, occasionally causing people to faint. In this case, however, it was her clothes that paid the price for her impatience.
Riiiiiippp! As the girl turned to face me, her clothes tore, scattering into tiny pieces in the wind.
Time seemed to slow to a halt as Miyo looked down at herself, let out a scream, and just barely managed to cover herself.
M-Miyo...
You...
I-I tried to warn you! I swear this isn't some kind of secret judo technique!
Y-You... Stay back. Na-Narumi?
Um... Yes, Miyo-chan?
P-Please g-get me a change of c-clothes.
Yes! Right away! I'll be back as soon as possible, I promise!
For some reason, I'm feeling less like a hero and more like a villain...
Narumi quickly rushed off, leaving Miyo and myself to ourselves. It felt different from last night.
I felt like I was walking on thin ice. As though one wrong word and she would begin to resent me the same way she resented spirits.
I'm sorry. I really didn't mean for it to end up like this. It was an accident.
S-So, you f-found my weakness...
Huh? No, I swear, it was just an accident. That hold usually just makes your clothes tighter!
N-Not that... I ca-can't... move. I... I have... perfected every area of b-being cool, and un-unrelenting... except n-n-nakedness. It's e-embarrassing.
I-I don't think you'd have anything you need to hide. I mean... You should be proud of your body!

It's n-not that. Th-The thought of people s-staring at me. It makes me f-feel dizzy. Like, I can b-barely think. I actually a-admire that about Narumi. She d-doesn't have a single ounce of shame in her.
Well, I think Narumi-chan would be the exception. Most girls would probably get embarrassed at being seen naked. I'm sure Narumi-chan will be here with your clothes soon.
I am not m-most girls. I sh-shouldn't get incapacitated this e-easily! It is infuriating. I lose all co-control of myself!
I'm not sure, but maybe it's something you'll be able to train. A weakness to overcome!
C-Can we do it now? P-Perhaps if you se-se-see--
She began stammering uncontrollably, blushing from ear to ear, unable to finish her sentence. I began to panic. I had never seen a girl get this worked up before.
Uhm, I think it would be better if you asked Narumi-chan about that.
B-But that won't work! I don't get like this when there are only g-girls around!
I-I guess but...
I felt as though every male in both worlds were cursing me for my indecisiveness.

At this very moment, a pretty girl stood before me, suggesting that I look at her naked, all for the sake of making her less embarassed in the future. How could I call myself a man if I declined such an invitation?!
But are you really okay with, uh... me?
I-I can't th-think of anyone else to d-do it. Please, Takahiro. L-L-Look at me.
Was this really happening? If it was, this was the best type of training I had ever experienced!
As Miyo began to move her arm, I turned my head. Unfortunately, at that very moment the doors slammed open, and in walked Maeko and Machiko, wrapped in towels.
It was nice of Elder-sama to allow us to use the baths. It will be nice to... TAKAHIRO!?
Nyahaha! Taka-nii and the Tsundere Tyrant are doing naughty things!
W-Wait! This... It's not what it looks like!
AAAHHHH!
And with that, the girl fainted again, slipping into the water before I had a chance to react.
It took a considerable amount of effort to convince the others that nothing unholy had been taking place.
Thanks to Narumi's testimony, coupled with Miyo's apparent habit of freezing, they believed me.
However, as I turned to leave, Narumi dragged me off to the side. It seemed like she wanted me to come see her later that evening in return for saving my hide.
I couldn't really see a way for me to weasel me out of that, so I reluctantly agreed.
That evening, I excused myself and made my way to Narumi's home, knocking lightly on the door.
Hey, Narumi-chan? Are you there?
Ahh... Just a moment! The door's open, but don't come in yet!
Curious, I found myself wondering what the girl had planned.
Perhaps she was preparing a meal, or something to surprise me with? Some sort of present? Or maybe she wanted to talk.
Whatever the reason might have been, Narumi's voice once again sounded from within the house.
Okay~ You can come in now, Takahiro-kun~
Feeling kind of excited, I opened the door and walked in, the door sliding shut behind me. The room was darker than I remembered, and it occurred to me to hunt for a light.

Foolishly, I began searching for a light switch, when I remembered that something like that was unlikely to exist here. I managed to locate a small lamp, and a nearby box of matches, lighting it with ease.
Turn around, Takahiro-kun~
I turned around and my eyes bulged. Standing before me was Narumi. Only... she seemed to be dripping.
Taking in the view, I let out a shriek. For a moment, I expected to see the slime girl, but then I noticed the smell of chocolate in the air.
P-Please tell me you're not possessed by some kind of chocolate spirit...
I instinctively found my eyes drifting along Narumi's chocolate-coated figure, trying to find any sign that a spirit should be involved. When I found none, I felt myself growing increasingly nervous.
Of course not, silly! Don't you like it? Don't you think it suits me, all sweet and delicious?
W-Well, I mean, you're sweet and all, and not just because of the chocolate... What in the world happened?!
Hehe! Thank you! Don't worry about the little details. Do you want a taste?
T-Taste?!

Yeah! That's what I was told, anyway. You put something tasty on your body and let someone else eat it. That's how you get close to people in your world, right? I think it was called... inti... intimi...
Hold on. Did someone tell you to do this? B-Because you do realize there's NO way this won't turn into s-s-s-se...

I stuttered as Narumi stepped closer, her pose causing me to swallow, trying my best to resist the temptation. At this rate, getting a stomache from eating all that chocolate, would be the least of my worries...
What's wrong, Takahiro-kun? Don't you want to be friends? Or don't you like chocolate? I have some honey, too, if you'd prefer that!
I love chocolate! But I d-don't think honey will be any better.
I don't get it! What's wrong? Is it because it's me? I bet if Miyo or Chi-chan did something like this, you'd be eating away right now!
The day Miyo-san coats herself in chocolate is the day pigs fly!
Haha... Yeah, she'd never do something like this! But I still don't get why you're not enjoying this. Did I do something wrong?
Umm... Narumi-chan, you see, this is usually something people do when... you know.
OH! Oh... Oh, wow, I uh... Wow. Um. So, I guess... I messed up pretty big, didn't I? Awwwh! I'm going to kick that shrine spirit's butt next time I see her! Ugh!
Wait, shrine spirit? Did Tsuyuri put you up to this?
Yeah! She told me this would help us bond or something.
W-Well, I guess we shouldn't let all that chocolate go to waste...
Narumi, I need to talk to you about... WHAT THE HELL IS GOING ON IN HERE!?
Your vice-captain is possessed by a chocolate spirit!
Ch-Choocoooolaaaaate~
Do I look like an idiot? This is because of earlier, isn't it?
