N-N-No, it's not! I promise! Someone just gave me a really, really, REALLY bad advice!
Really? Well then. Allow me to give you some GOOD advice: go and get yourself cleaned up, NOW. Before anyone else sees you like this!
Honestly, you are the face of this village! You could have been called to defend it at any moment. Do you think yourself capable in a state like this?
I think most people would--
I AM NOT FINISHED! Narumi, you are sleeping in my spare room tonight. Takahiro! Clean up this mess. If you do not complete this task before morning, you will not get to sleep.
And if you do not complete this task before breakfast, you will not be getting any breakfast!
That's a bit unfair, isn't it?
I sighed, the shouting and angry glares from the samurai girl making me feel a bit too intimidated to decline her demands.
As she marched the dejected, and still chocolate-coated girl out of the house, shielding her with an old robe, I took a look around. It was going to take me hours to get rid of all this chocolate!
If Ichikawa ever finds out about this, he's going to give me hell...
It had been a week since I came to this world.
I spent my days helping out around the village and training with Miyo and Narumi. I even tried my hand at repairing some of the damage done by Sakura.
I still had no clue where I was, but I was enjoying the time spent here. Everything reminded me of things I had read about in the school history books, from the buildings to the people.
I looked at the nearby girls and let out a sigh. The history books never said anything about fox girls or spirits. There were mentions of them in various religious texts, but they weren't real!
So... You're sure this wedding sash will be able to get me back to my world?
In the end, Maeko had been able to research the spell even further, have made huge progress over the past few days.
Tsuyuri was able to provide some details. She believes that the spell will return something to where it belongs. I suppose it is worth a try.
It will work! I know it will! I just need some time to prepare.
I'm not sure if I should be grateful or worried. Still, I didn't think you'd be able to figure it out so fast, Maeko-chan.
Hehehe, yup! Magic is super easy! Just a wave and a flash and it's done!
Except the time it will take you to prepare the ingredients. Do not underestimate the arcane arts, Maeko-chan. You have a gift. Make sure you treat it with the respect it deserves.
'A wave and a flash'? Umm... I'm not going to end up exploding into fireworks or something, right?
Absolutely, probably, not! I guarantee it! Don't worry, Taka-nii! I won't do anything that'll hurt you. I hope.
Unless you happen to be made of clay, glass, wood, or stone. These all seem to shatter when you try to cast the spell on them.
Onee-sama! You didn't have to tell him that!
Oh boy... Good thing the human body is mostly made up of water.
Let's take a break. I'm feeling a bit...
Distracted by the younger girl's excitement, I didn't notice as sweat had started forming on my forehead, a sudden dizziness coming over me.
Without a warning, I collapsed onto the ground, my breathing heavy and ragged. As my vision faded, the girls ran towards me, shouting my name in concern.
I slowly regained consciousness, opening my eyes to take in the familiar surroundings of the room I had occupied during my stay within this unfamiliar world.
I was surprised to find the two fox spirits in the room with me, seemingly in the middle of preparing something.
Taka-kun. It is good to see you awake again. You were unconscious for quite some time. How are you feeling?
A bit tired, but I'm okay.
What happened?
You sprung quite a high fever. I have prepared some food for you. It will be ready soon. Maeko-chan is preparing a spell that will hopefully improve your condition.
I think you have a cold. You were so hot and sweaty, I had to get you out of your clothes. To wash them.
My head still felt a little bit fuzzy from the rest, but I was probably just exhausted from the constant training.
I guess even a hero gets sick sometimes.
It took me a moment to realize what Machiko had said. Raising the blanket, I found myself left in nothing but a pair of shorts. I instantly blushed.
W-W-Why would you take my clothes?!
Being near naked in the presence of someone as pretty as Machiko, I kept the blanket close enough to be a second layer of skin.
I'm almost ready, onee-sama.
Machiko suddenly slipped past me, startling me in the process as her hands gently grasped my shoulders, pulling me against her.
None of our robes fit you. This was the best we could do. I need you to relax.
Easier said than done...
Who would be able to relax with a girl hugging them. The lack of clothes only made me more nervous!
Just lean back against me, and watch. Maeko-chan is about to give you a demonstration of her powers. It would be rude not to pay attention. And I would hate to have to punish you for being rude.
As those words were whispered into my ear like the temptations of a succubus, I kept my eyes on the younger sibling.
The sight of the young fox spirit, seemingly in the middle of preparing some sort of ritualistic spell, caused me to momentarily forget about my embarrassment.
Don't be alarmed if you feel any unusual sensations. Once the spell takes hold, it usually takes a few moments to flow through you. Feel free to grab hold of me if you need to.
Despite my attempt to protest, I decided that it was best not to worry too much about it. It wasn't like she was going to blow me up or anything.
As though in a daze, I watch as small glowing orbs started to gather in the room, urged on by the soft whispers of the young fox spirit who had finally started her spell.
Maybe I should accept Machiko's invitation before something blew up in my face.
Aaand... Huah!
As I watched, the girl began to swirl her arms around. Tiny balls of light, like fireflies, began to appear in the vortex of her swirling hands, spinning around her.

The light had a warm feeling to it, not hurtful to the eyes, but still more intense than a candle or a light bulb. Finally, she began to move her whole body, a dance of sorts that made the light flare even brighter.
It makes me jealous, seeing her like this. Not of her power, but her beauty. In this moment, she is the most beautiful creature in the world...
I won't disagree with you there.
Ah, but would you choose her over me? Which do you like better? Maturity? Or youthful vigor? Or perhaps a stern tsundere is more your type? Or are you...
I could tell she was just poking fun at me, despite my current state. I was about to offer a reply in return, when I felt a tingle inside me.
It felt similar to the sensation of swallowing fizzing candy, only throughout my entire body.
Ohhh, this feels weird!
Aaaaaand... it's done! And he didn't even explode! Yaaay!
Wait, what?
Tell me, do you feel any better, Taka-kun?
I... feel a bit weird. Like my entire body is tingling. I really hope I won't explode...
Nyahaha! If you were going to explode, you would've done it by now! You'll be super fine in no time at all! Dinner, dinner! NNNGHHH!
Almost as soon as she had finished her spell, Maeko clutched her head in her hands and fell to her knees.
Machiko seemed as startled as myself by Maeko's sudden display of pain. As I tried to get back onto my feet, Machiko rushed to her side.
Maeko! You need to show more restraint! Please, lie down. Taka-kun, can you keep an eye on her? I am going to prepare something that will help her.
Of course! Come, Maeko-chan. You should lie down over here.
Finally regaining my footing, I made my way over to Maeko's side.
After making sure her sister was left in good hands, Machiko left the room, leaving me alone with the groaning girl who had been struck by a nasty headache after casting her spell.
Ahh... Onee-sama... Taka-nii...
Don't worry, Maeko-chan. I'm sure your sister will be back soon. Try to relax a bit until then.
Taka-nii... do you like onee-sama?
W-Where did that question come from?!
Onee-sama asked, but you never answered. I don't mind, you know... if you like onee-sama over me. I'd sure like it if you liked me, though!
I, umm... How do I explain this...
I paused briefly, trying to think of a good way to respond, when I finally decided to play it safe. I raised a hand and gently patted the girl's head, offering a warm smile.
I like you both. Just like I like Narumi-chan and Miyo-san. You're all friends I've managed to make in this new world.
No, silly! Of course you like all of us! But who do you, you know. LIKE like. Onee-sama was asking about your type, and I know what that means.
Oh, you mean it like that...
To be honest, I've been focusing so much on my judo, that I haven't really thought about it. How about I make you and your sister a promise?
A promise?
Yeah, a promise. I'm not really ready to answer a question like that yet. Judo has always been 'it'.
It's why I need to get back to my world. To win that match. It's been my dream since I was a kid, and real men don't give up on their dreams!
But I'll promise you, that after my match, I'll do everything I can to return to this world. This time as a man who will be able to answer your question.
So, now I'll have a reason to come back here. Because a real man always keeps his promise!
Ehehehe! That makes me happy!
As we sat there for a while, I suddenly heard strange shuffling sound. Maeko apparently heard it as well, squeaking as she toppled back onto her rear.
Nyehehe, I fell again. I guess I'm not all better yet!
You probably shouldn't move around too much, Maeko-chan. You're probably tired after that thing you did just now.
Nyaah! I'm fiiine!
Her tail twitched about eagerly behind her, hiking her skirt up high enough to be revealing.
Hmm, are you now? You seem to be fidgeting a lot for some reason.
Nyoooh! You're seeing things! I'm fine!
Amused by her behavior, I watched on as she curled her hands and twitched her ears, using a voice that didn't sound quite like her.
In the back of my head, I found myself thinking that she looked very much like... well, like a cat.
Is it normal for a fox to act like a cat? I could have sworn you looked ready to pounce a mouse any second just now.
Nyaah, magic makes me do weird things sometimes. One time, onee-sama had to get a ladder because I had climbed a tree and was building a nest!
Speaking of mice... I think Taka-nii looks like one!
W-W-Wait! I'm totally a Tom, not a Jerry!
Huh? Silly Taka-nii. Talking about your world, trying to confuse me! I'm definitely going to pounce you!
My eyes quickly scanned the area around me, hoping to find something I could distract her with. At least long enough for Machiko to return.
I spotted a long piece of thread off to one side and decided to grab it, dangling it in front of Maeko's face.
Pounce this instead!
NYAAAH!
The girl began to swat and lash at the string, putting a bit of distance between the two of us. Happy that I had managed to prevent another embarrassing scene, I lied back...
...only to be greeted by the ever rising skirt of Maeko, reminding me of the exact reason the sisters had gone to the village in the first place.
W-Wait Maeko-chan! If you jump now, I'll see something that can't be unseen! Y-Your skirt is about to--
I waved a hand in her general direction, averting my eyes as I tried to hide the blush on my face.
Wha... KYAAAAHHHH!!!!!
With a shriek that undoubtedly shook the mansion's very foundation, the girl slammed a hand down onto her skirt, hiding herself from me in hopes of saving her dignity.
Oh no! I'm not a maiden anymore! I can't wear white at my wedding!
I swear I didn't see anything! You're totally still a maiden, but please tell your sister to get you two some underwear. If not for your own sake, then for that of the entire male species!
Onee-sama, Taka-nii says we need underwear!
As the girl called out, I felt another wave of dizziness wash over me. My vision began to swim, and I felt myself shiver.
If this was indeed a cold, it seemed like I had drawn the short end of the straw. I let out a groan and lied back down again, clutching my own body.
Oh my goodness! Maeko, your spell wore off faster than expected! Here, Taka-kun, eat some of this. It will make you feel better.
I nibbled on the mixture Machiko spoon fed me. It tasted bad but it made me feel better.
What's wrong with him, onee-sama?
Fear not, little one. It is nothing life threatening. But he must have caught quite a bad case. We are fortunate we caught it early.
Your spell did wonders, though. The cold just happened to be a lot worse than we thought. Do not worry.
If you say so...
He will be fine. His fever has gone down. But he is cold. We will need to warm him up somehow. I will go get some more food. Could you fetch some blankets?
Blankets? But I know something that'll warm him up a LOT faster!
Just as I started to feel better, my blurred vision recovered in time to witness a sight that nearly had me faint once more.
Standing before me was the youngest of the fox spirits, eagerly undoing her top for the sake of my well being.
MAEKO! WHAT ARE YOU DOING!?
M-Maeko-chan?!
Nyehehe! When you were all cold the other day, onee-sama got naked and snuggled up close to you! So, I figured it was my turn!
E-Even if I appreciate the gesture, I don't think that's how you cure a cold!
Put your clothes back on right now! You are going to give him the wrong idea!
Aww! But you two looked so cute, all cuddled up together. I wanted to try it, too... You're no fun sometimes, onee-sama!
Y-You did what? I-I'm not sure what to think of that, Machiko-san.
W-What!? Sh-She is talking about when we first met!! And I didn't have a choice. You were ice cold! I only made use of my body heat!
Exactly! And now I'm going to do the same!
B-But I'm feeling hot right now, not cold!
But you're shivering! I definitely need to warm you up!
It's hopeless... You might as well let her do it. However! Maeko, before you do anything, you are NOT to take off your clothes! Am I making myself clear?
Aww, but...
No buts! Neither of you are feeling well. Wearing nothing at all will only make you worse!
H-Hey, don't I get a say in this? Having a pretty girl in bed with me is going to make this fever skyrocket!
You see, Maeko? You are bothering him! Just settle down and watch over him. I need to prepare the soup!
B-But... But... I was just... trying to help out...
Y-You're not bothering me! B-But remember that talk we had earlier, and the promise? You're trying to gain an unfair advantage over the others...
What promise? Have you been promising naughty things to my little sister, Taka-kun?
No! I just promised her that I'd return to this world once I've finished some business I have back home. I told her I wou... Maeko-chan, why are you taking off your clothes again?!
Hehehe! I want to win!
Maeko! What in the world is all this about? Why are you so adamant about showing your body to Taka-kun? What sort of ridiculous deal have you two going on? Put your clothes back on!
You're technically the one who started all this... And Maeko-chan, you really shouldn't try to win like this. Not to mention, I might die of a nosebleed before you can claim your prize...
What do you mean, I started it? And what prize? I demand you tell me this instant!
Hmph! Fine! Taka-nii promised me that he'd tell me which of us he likes the best.
Not as friends, but... you know... the different kind of like! And he's the prize! Whoever gets Taka-nii to like like him is the winner! And I want to win!
O-Oh... well... uh, I hadn't really... been thinking about what would happen if you... I suppose that is a, uh, nice thing to promise. Uh... Maeko-chan, could you please leave us alone for a moment?
Aww, why? You're not going to try anything funny, are you? Because that's cheating, onee-sama!
After pulling her top back down, the younger girl stomped out of the room, huffing and crossing her arms. She seemed quite irritated now, but perhaps this was another side effect of the spell.
As she left, she slammed the door behind her, making the room rattle.
I am sorry about that. She gets like this sometimes. Stubborn and indignant when something does not go the way she wants it to.
That kind of reminds me of someone...
I must confess, though... My actions have not been entirely genuine. I have grown quite fond of having you around, Taka-kun. This promise that you made... do you really think you can keep it?
Of course! Even if I have to spend the rest of my life at the shrine shouting Tsuyuri name, I'll make sure to return to this world.
Taka-kun!
The girl knelt beside me and hugged me tightly, completely without warning. I didn't really know how to react, so I just sat there, letting her finish.
I am so happy to hear you say that! The thought that we may never see you again... I do not think I could handle that!
Even though judo is an important part of my life, my friends are just as important. You won't get rid of me that easily.
I know this will make the villagers happy, too. Taka-kun, thank you!
I smiled briefly at Machiko before I felt another dizzy attack coming onl. Deciding to lie down, I pulled away from her embrace.
I'm sorry, Machiko-san, but I think I'll be getting a bit more sleep, if that's okay.
Take all the time you need. We will be here when you wake up, so rest now. Sleep well, Taka-kun.
And with those words I closed my eyes, vaguely able to make out a whisper before the girl left the room, letting me slip off to dreamland.
Several days later
Three days later, I learned that the festival the villagers had been preparing for was coming up. I didn't know the details, but the girls had been adamant that I pay the village a visit that night.
However, because it was still early in the morning, I had decided that I would check the kitchen first, and figure out if I could somehow prepare the sisters a meal to show my gratitude to them.
As I made my way towards the kitchen, the sound of cheerful humming made me realize that someone was already inside.
Someone's up before me? It can't be Machiko-san. She sleeps till noon...
Hehehe! Come on in, Taka-nii! I'm whipping up a treat just for you!
Ah, Maeko--
My words were quickly cut off as I entered the kitchen and found Maeko running around excitedly. That, by itself, wouldn't have been enough to surprise me.
I had already come to know that she was the actual cook in the family, but...
It was her lack of clothes that gave me more than enough reason to panic!
M-M-Maeko-chan! W-What in the world is that you're wearing?
Good morning, Taka-nii! Do you like it~? It was a present from Tsu-chan!
Y-Yeah, I... W-Wait a minute! If your sister saw you like this, doomsday wouldn't be far off!
So, be quiet and she won't wake up! Hehehe!
I can't decide which one of you is the most dangerous.
Why would Tsuyuri even give you an apron like that? I mean, what happened to your other clothes? Don't tell me you traded them for the apron.
Don't be silly! That would be stupid! Tsu-chan gave them to me! And not just an apron! Look! Undies, too! You told me I should wear some.
Although I agree with the underwear part, I don't think wearing an apron alone is considered normal!
Not that I would mind you walking around like that every now and then...
I asked Tsu-chan what I could do to make a human from your world like me.
She told me that men from your world love waking up to a girl wearing just undies and an apron. And who cooks breakfast for them! She gave me a pair of her own undies so I could do that for you!
I-I won't deny that, but... There's a certain order to things, you know! You're skipping a bunch of scenes!
Oh! I thought I was doing it right... Waah, Taka-nii, you're so mean! I just wanted to do something nice for you! I even whipped up my special waffle recipe for you!
That sounds great and all, but...
I coughed and averted my gaze for a moment.
Remember that talk about taking unfair advantages? You're practically hacking your way to victory...
I'm not hacking anything! I did break a couple of eggs, but... I didn't cut anything. That's something scary Miyo would do!
It's a term from my world that we use to describe when someone is playing a game and... You know what, nevermind.
I won't say anything this time. Just promise me you'll change back in your clothes before your sister sees you...
Yaaay! I promise, I promise! Would you like some cream on your special waffle? Or would you like to put it on yourself?
N-No! Regular is fine.
The young girl smiled, grabbing a plate before walking over to me. Leaning down, she placed the plate on the table in front of me.
I swallowed hard as I received a full view of her cleavage, purposely focusing on her tail as she turned and walked away.
Maybe I should bring some up for onee-sama, as well. After all, I want her to like me too! Do you think she'd like me if I gave her breakfast like this?
Y-You definitely shouldn't do that, Maeko-chan. I can promise you that your sister already likes you a lot.
I'm pretty sure you'll trigger a death flag if you head upstairs.
Oh, okay! By the way, since we're allowed to come into the village now, onee-sama and I have been thinking about going to the festival tonight! You should come with us! It would be so much fun!
Mmmhh, that smells amazing! Maeko-chan, have you been making waffles again?
Ahh! Oh no! Taka-kun, run! Get out of here! Run! Before she sees you!
Fearing the worst as Machiko's steps progressively came closer, I quickly realized that staying where I was would lead to one hell of a huge misunderstanding.
I-I'll leave her to you...

With those last words, I darted out of the kitchen and into the woods. It appeared I made it just in time, because a moment later a shrill scream and a thunderous roar sounded from within the mansion.
Although I was grateful for the waffles and the lingering mental image that Maeko had left me with, I didn't dare to stay behind for her sister's wrath.
As I continued into the woods, making a beeline past the trees, I descended into less traversed parts of the forest.
I hoped I would be able to hide myself long enough for Machiko to calm down. However, it wasn't long before a familiar voice reached my ears, causing me to come to a grinding halt.
You seem to be in a hurry, Takahiro.
I spun around on the spot and saw the one person I had least expected. With her tail swaying eagerly behind her, the spirit of the shrine seemed to have decided to grace me with her presence.
Or rather, you look as though you're being chased by a demon.
That's awfully ironic coming from you.
Well, I do enjoy looking out for lost little children in my forest. Teasing aside, you seem to be enjoying yourself.
You could say there's a certain charm to this place and the people that live here.
I can't help but think that the reason is something more... specific.
I guess you're the one responsible for Maeko-chan's silly behavior these past few days.
Hohoho~ Perhaps! But there is a reason behind this.
Does it involve getting a wedding sash?
Hardly! That's too simple of a goal. There is a much greater problem that require your attention.
It seems like your ticket back home shall be arriving quite soon. How fortunate! Just in time for your little game of violence!
Wait, what do you mean? Are you saying that... I'll be able to return soon?
That is correct. Soon, you will be gone, and I'll finally be free to play with my dear Machi-tan again. Free from her strange fascination with you!
What about this problem you mentioned?
You'll figure that out soon enough. But I'll give you a hint, boy. This is a problem only you can solve. No one from this world will have the solution.
For a moment, the spirit's gaze shifted sideways, clearly in the middle of a thought before she returned to look at me quite happily.
In any case, that is all you are going to get out of me. Don't disappoint me now, Takahiro. It is usually considered unwise to do so.
And with those words the spirit stepped backwards, seemingly fading away into the scenery as though she had been a simple illusion all along.
Her comments worried me a little, and if there was going to be some sort of problem, I felt it would be best to inform the girls. But who would I end up warning?
In the end, I decided it was best to return to the mansion.
Surely Machiko would have calmed down enough by now. I did feel a bit guilty about leaving Maeko to deal with her all by herself.
I walked back towards the mansion, and to my surprise, I saw Machiko sitting outside, on the steps. I vaguely considered turning around at this point, but she saw me and gestured for me to approach.
Take a seat, Taka-kun. I need to talk to you.
I swallowed again, walking up the steps and taking a seat beside her. We sat in silence for a few minutes, until she cleared her throat.

I love my sister, Taka-kun. Dearly. However, recently, I have found myself resenting her for the time she gets to spend with you. I do not know how to deal with this. I find myself in one unfair situation after another.
Oh...
I spoke with Maeko earlier. We have come to an agreement.
We will both wait. We both trust you, Taka-kun. We are both going to wait, until you fulfill your promise to return, before we try to win you!
There will be no more flirting from me, and no more silly antics from Maeko. I am sorry to have dragged you into this family feud, but I fear it could not be helped.
There's no need to be sorry, Machiko-san. As your friend, I kind of hope you'll talk to me if something like that bothers you.
But I'm happy you were able to bury the hatchet.
Ah, but I hope you will come prepared. The battle will be intense upon your return! Maeko said she would like to apologize to you. I believe she is in her room right now.
I'll make sure to prepare myself for the greatest battle ever fought! But for now, I'll go find Maeko-chan.
I dashed past Machiko, who nodded as I walked past, lounging back on the deck in the early morning sun.

I climbed the stairs of the mansion, looking around at what appeared to be the aftermath of their 'discussion'. I thanked whatever angel was watching over me that I hadn't been around to witness or experience it.
Maeko-chan, I'm coming in! Machiko-san said you wanted to talk.
No, wait!
By the time I heard her cry, it was too late. Through the open door, I saw her skirt halfway up her hips, her hands clasped around her chest. Maeko let out a shriek.
A-Ah! I-I'm sorry, I didn't know you were changing!
Ahh! Get out! Get out, get out, get out, get out!
Okay, okay! I'm sorry, I'm so sorry, I didn't mean to--
I was cut off as I tried to leave, bumping into something rather warm and soft. The obstacle in question gasped as I toppled backwards into the room.
Maeko! And after our talk, no less! Honestly, I can't trust you to keep decent at all these days, can I?
W-Wait! Onee-sama! I didn't do anything this time! I promise! I swear! I didn't plan this! I was just trying to get changed! Taka-nii's the one who burst in before I had a chance to cover myself up!
It was an accident! I didn't even know if Maeko was in here! I was trying to find her!
Honestly, you two! Do not think I have forgotten about what happened earlier. You two are definitely up to something!
Onee-sama! I swear!
She's right! This is all just a big mistake!
Hmpf. Fine. I believe you. Maeko, you are my sister, and I love and trust you. Takahiro! You are a pervert who loves peeking on girls!
You should always knock, and then wait, before entering a room. What if it had been the Tsundere Tyrant? Your head would quickly have left your shoulders behind!

I'm terrified of how spot on your statement would have been... In any case, I wanted to let you two know that I don't mind attending the festival with you. That is, if you want to accompany a peeking pervert like me...
I added the last bit with a bit of a dramatic sob, acting as if I had been hurt by the comments. A scolded puppy could learn a thing or two from the pitiful expression I wore just then.
Oh! I could wear that nice frilly thing that Tsu-chan gave me! You know, the one she said she wanted to see you in, but when you saw it you turned white as a sheet, and I think you kind of fainted.
Tsu-chan gave it to me when you were out cold, and told me to keep it 'just in case'.
Giggling to herself, she ran to her closet, searching through piles of clothes in search of the dress.
I slapped a hand over my eyes, turning my head away as she rummaged through her room in her half naked state.
MAEKO! Change first, then consider your wardrobe! I do, however, have one small request. Do not wear anything that fiend has given you!
Aww, no fair! Tsu-chan gives me such pretty skirts and tops! She's really generous. You should wear some of it sometimes! Oh! Onee-sama, does that include these panti--
NO! Keep those on! You are completely hopeless! Taka-kun, thank you very much for the invitation. We will both graciously accept.
I, umm... think it's best for me to wait outside. Machiko-san, I think you better help your sister out with her choice of wardrobe. If the villagers saw her in certain outfits...
I found myself wondering what would happen if Maeko actually did end up going to the festival wearing nothing but an apron and her panties, but eventually let the thought go.
The girls asked me to meet them at the outskirts of the village. After a short wait, they both arrived, wearing their usual clothes.
I had to admit, I was a little disappointed. I had hoped to see them in something a little... fancier.
This will be the first time we have interacted with the village as a whole. I figured it would be a good idea to make a positive first impression, rather than an odd one.
I'm sure you'll be fine. This past week has really helped the village realize not all spirits are troublemakers.
Onee-sama, look! It's so pretty! All those lights!
It was amazing to see the village like this. The villagers had really gone all out, making the whole place glow, the light flickering candles dancing in the evening breeze.
It is beautiful. Thank you for giving us this chance, Taka-kun. Without your help, I doubt we would have been allowed anywhere near the village on this night.
It actually reminds me of festivals back in my world, so in a way I'm able to show a bit of my world tonight.
I smiled, feeling pretty happy as I thought about my own city.
Despite the difference in time, and even world, I could easily see the similarities between this festival and the ones that were held back home.
People would visit from all over, and the city would be filled with all kinds of decorations.
It actually made me feel a bit homesick.
Taka-nii? Is something wrong?
Oh... No, it's nothing. I was just thinking about my world. But let's do something fun! Look over there! That's a pretty fun game! I bet I'll be able to beat you in it any day!
Do you want me to explain the rules, fair maidens in my company?
We would love to play with you, Taka-kun! Please, tell us how.
The three of us quickly made our way to the stall in question, which had a large wooden container placed in front of it.
Filled with water, tiny goldfish could be seen eagerly swimming back and forth.
Okay, the rules are pretty simple. You'll be given a small bowl and a little paper net. You have to use the net to scoop the fish out of the water.
But the net is really fragile, so it will break if you aren't careful. The one who captures the most is the winner.
Oh, and you're usually allowed to take one home. If you catch any, that is.
AH! ONEE-SAMA! FISHIES!
Haha, yes, you can keep one, Maeko-chan. I would love to watch you play, Taka-kun, but I feel that this is not a game for me.
Here. Elder-sama was kind enough to give us a small amount of money for my work here this past week. Enjoy yourselves!
May the best fisher win!
I'm going to catch a fishie!
I couldn't help but grin at Maeko's change of demeanor. When she was told that she would be allowed to keep a fish if she caught one, the girl's excitement got the best of her.
After several vigorous scoops, the little scoop tore apart, ending Maeko's game without a single fish caught.
The dejected expression on the girl's face made me feel sorry for her and instead, I moved behind her, putting my own net into her hand while I rested my hands on top of her own.
Let's do this together, Maeko-chan. Just follow my hands. It's a game that requires you to be patient.
First you need to get the whole thing wet. If it's only partially wet, it'll rip in no time at all. Let it float in the water, don't let it struggle against it.
Now, keep it at an angle, and wait. When a fish gets close, scoop it up from the head, and try to avoid the tail. It sometimes causes the net to break. Then, you just slip it into the bowl!
I showed her the best way to scoop and moved back, watching her focus intently on the water.
She didn't move a muscle for well over a minute, until suddenly her arm twitched and she made a little squeak. There was a small splash, and the faint sound of ripping paper.
YES! I DID IT! I GOT ONE! I got one, I got one! Thank you so much, Taka-nii! I caught a goldfish!
Great job! Now you'll have a goldfish to keep at the mansion. Take good care of it.
The stall owner bagged the fish for Maeko in a special water filled bag. I gently patted the girl's head as we walked back to Machiko.
The older girl seemed to be interested in some masks that resembled different kinds of demons back in my world, making me wonder what she was thinking about.
Onee-sama, I got a fishie! Isn't it cute?
Oh, well done, little one! It is absolutely adorable! Taka-kun, I am a little curious about these masks.
You want one? I have some money myself, from the time I helped out the guards, so...
I am actually more curious about their purpose. The stall owner seemed to evade the question when I asked him.
Haha! Well, in my world, they are said to ward off evil spirits. Maybe it's the same here?
Well then! I would most certainly like one! If nothing else, it would go a long way to prove that I am most certainly not an evil spirit!
I think they know that already. There's no way two pretty girls like you could be evil spirits.
I would still like a mask, though. For... reasons. Alright, so I want to wear one! I got a little jealous that Maeko got to do something fun!
Do you want me to pick one for you?
The girl nodded her head, pouting a little as she pretended not to care, even though I knew that she wanted me to do it.
Well, if you insist...
With a grin, I eagerly started looking through the row of masks, trying to find one that would suit her. There were cute ones, intimidating ones, and downright weird ones I had never seen before.
In the end, I picked one of the cute masks. I wasn't sure what type of demon it was supposed to depict, but it would have to do.
How about this one, Machiko-san? Isn't it cute?
As I showed her the mask, it kind of... resembled the face of some kind of feline creature.
The thought of Machiko putting it on, her fox ears poking out from over the top of the mask, had me on the verge of having a laughing fit.
It is very... um... nice. Thank you, Taka-kun. I will treasure it forever.
Put it on~! Put it on! Show us you're not an evil spirit.
O-Okay. Uh... Oh, um... I may need a little assistance getting it over my ears...
Hehe, no... It looks perfect like that! It combines the charms of a fox spirit and the feline grace of a... well, whatever it is.
I let a snicker slip before the sound of hasty footsteps suddenly reached my ears.
Takahiro-kun, there's trouble!
Turning towards the sound of the voice, I saw the village elder rushing towards us, seemingly in a panic. Then I finally noticed it. The festival had become eerily quiet.
The spirit that attacked us the other day is back. And she brought her companions along with her!
What!?
Onee-sama...
W-Wait, are you saying they're here? At the festival?!
Yes, they all seem agitated about something...
Sakura... What has she done now?
You have to hurry! Tsukino-dono and Narumi-chan are about to fight them. You must help them!
I need more time to prepare a spell! Onee-sama, I don't know if I can do it!
Do not worry, Maeko-chan! I'm sure we will think of something.
Maeko-chan, I have an idea. But I'm going to need your help. Let's just get there. Where are they, Elder-sama?
Near the bonfire at the village plaza.
Nodding my head in confirmation, the three of us set off in the direction of the plaza, hoping we would arrive in time.
Figuring it would be best to let the girls cool off, I decided to head to the village.
As I arrived, I found the villagers busy preparing the final touches for the festival that evening.
Everything seemed to be going well, and one or two people even greeted me as I wandered through the village.
I asked for the whereabouts of Miyo and Narumi, and was pointed in the direction of the last place anyone seemed to have seen them.
With Tsuyuri's warning still fresh in my mind, I decided it was best to talk with Miyo or Narumi about it.

Since they were in charge of defending the village, it wouldn't be a bad idea to warn them them that there could be some problems. I knocked on the door twice, and being in a bit of a hurry, announced my presence.
Miyo? Are you in here?
Y-Yes!
I opened the door before the girl had a chance to answer, and to my surprise, Miyo had been busy changing into a kimono!
Actually, who was I kidding? I should have known by now that girls always seem to be changing whenever I enter a room, judging by the events of this past week.
Ah! T-Takahiro! I require some assistance here. I am not used to these... complicated clothes!
Oh... A kimono! S-Sure, I'll help you out.
Yes, a kimono! I... I wanted to look nice. F-For the festival! I wanted to make a good impression. I am the head of the guard, you know!
Alright, alright. I think it makes you look some kind of mysterious beauty, though.
B-B-Beauty!? Q-Quit saying such nonsense! I should make you run ten laps for saying something ridiculous like that!
Just take the compliment, Miyo-san.
I laughed as I approached the girl, making sure to not let my eyes wander too much while I helped her put on the kimono.
So, what's the problem?
It is this confounded obi! I cannot wrap it around myself without the kimono slipping too low! And since I cannot get a hang of it myself, you will have to do!
Ah, I can see why you're having trouble. You're wrapping it around the wrong way. Here, hand me the sash. You're trying to do what someone else should do for you!
Using the method my mother had taught me, we eventually got the obi tied properly. After a bit of struggling, we managed to adjust the kimono to perfection, and Miyo was successfully changed.
Upon closer inspection, I really liked the way Miyo looked just then. Before I knew it, I found myself idly wondering if Narumi would be wearing a kimono, as well.
Thank you, Takahiro. In return, you will attend the festival as my companion. You will pick me up here and escort me around the village. We will play games and watch the fireworks together.
Before I had a chance to reply, a cheerful voice sounded from behind me.
Hey Miyo! I figured you'd need some help with your... Whoa! You look awesome! You should wear that more often! Oh! Takahiro-kun, you're here, too! Hey, wait a minute, did you two hook up?
What!? That is ridiculous! S-Stop saying such embarrassing things, Hikage!
Hey, how's that embarrassing?! You were telling me to go out on a date with you just a moment ago!
WHAAAAAT!? No fair! I didn't know we could do that! Miyo-chan you meanie! I want to go on a date with Takahiro-kun, too! I want to spend the festival with him!

Th-That is not why I asked! I s-simply thought it would be a good show of public r-relations, if the person who changed our view on spirits were seen having a g-good time with the captain of the guard!
Oho? Well, if that's the case, why didn't you just ask Chi-chan or Maeko-chan? That would have been way better than going with Takahiro-kun!
I, umm... I kind of have something I need to discuss with you, so I think I better go with at least one of you tonight.
There's enough of me for the both of you. One can have the 'Taka' and the other can have the 'Hiro'.
Hmmmmm... I guess that could work! A double date with just one guy! Things could get pretty interesting, hmhmhm!
Narumi! Get that lewd expression off of your face this instant! This is NOT a date! It is for cultural purposes only!
Yeah, whatever! I came over to see if you needed help with your dress, not work. I'll see you both later. I'll have to step up my game for tonight!
Geez, getting all diplomatic, huh? That's pretty amazing!
After being kicked from Miyo's house, I decided to linger around the village to help speed up the preparations for the festival.
The village elder approached me a shortly before nightfall, and offered me a change of clothes which I graciously accepted. It was another long robe, this one silky, and of very high quality.
Finally, after hours of waiting, the festival began.
The village looked completely different once nightfall arrived. Lights and vibrant streamers decorated the every inch of the village, and various stalls were selling food and games.
It was an amazing sight to behold, and I wasn't just talking about the village itself.
The two female guards approached me from the left, both dressed in beautiful kimono they had prepared for the occasion. Without realizing it, I found myself smiling in a slightly goofy manner.
Wipe that dumb grin off of your face, you fool. You are here as a cultural envoy, not as some overly eager child!
You look amazing, Takahiro-kun! Those clothes really suit you!
I could be saying the same, Narumi-chan! How does it look? Did you mistake me for a noble gentleman from a distant kingdom? I might even take one of you home as my bride-to-be.
Hehehe! Who knows! Oh, Takahiro-dono, would you be willing to accompany me to the stall over there? Let's enjoy the festivities! Hehe!
Hikage, stop this ridiculousness! We are not here to have fun!
Aww, lighten up, Miyo! Can't you just relax for one damn evening?
Cheer up, Miyo-san! You look cuter when you're smiling.
Come on! Hey, why don't we go play that ring toss game? You used to like that when we were younger. You know, when you weren't thrashing yourself training all day...
Hmmph... I don't know...
We can all play together, if you want. I'll let you have the prize even if I win!
You two will not leave this alone, will you? Alright, fine, we can play ONE game!
We made our way over to the ring toss game. Several sticks lined the back of the stall, each thicker or thinner depending on the difficulty and prize associated with it.
I handed the stall owner his money and received nine wooden rings in return.
Here we go, three each! Good luck!
I do not need luck! I have skill on my side!

Ten minutes later, we were still at the stall. Narumi had won a ticket for a free snack from a nearby stall, and I had won a little candy, which I initially offered to Miyo, who flat out refused to eat it.
Getting increasingly frustrated with her many losses, she ended up spending most of her money trying to get even a single ring onto the wooden pegs to no avail.
Okay, uh... Miyo... We're going to go get some food, okay? We'll be back in a bit.
Confounded... wooden... devils! I WILL DEFEAT THIS GAME!
You can do it, Miyo-san!
With those words of encouragement, I followed after Narumi who seemed rather eager to drag me along.
We arrived at one of the many stalls that lined the streets. Narumi showed her prize ticket to the woman behind the stall, who nodded, and brought the snack Narumi had picked.
As we waited, I idly looked around at the nearby stalls until a cough brought me back to my senses.
In the girl's hand was... some kind of snack. It reminded me of the chocolate-coated bananas we had back home, which would explain why it hadn't taken her long to get her food.
However, the way she was eating it immediately set off alarm bells in my head.
Mmm, this is so good! In a way, I'm glad they only make them during festivals. Otherwise I'd be eating them all the time. I would get so fat! Do you want a bite, Takahiro-kun?
I-I think I'll pass.
Oh, okay. More for me to gobble up, then! I love the textures, too. The hard outer shell and the cold gooey insides! I love the cream they drizzle on it, too. I could just lap it all up!
I'm sure the banana is enjoying it, as well.
Make sure you don't spill anything. It would be a shame if you got chocolate... on your...
I shook my head and averted my eyes, mainly because I knew something was bound to happen, given my luck.
Considering the Grand Canyon lurking underneath her clothes, I doubted my mind would be able to endure the sight.
Oops! Thank you. I nearly dropped some already!
I think I'm beginning to understand why Buddhist monks spend their time under a waterfall...
It's okay. I caught it with my fingers. Are you sure you don't want a bite, Takahiro-kun? You can have this on my fingers, if you want to!
I-I think I'll... I, uh...
Oh, come on, I'm just messing with you! Chi-chan's been teaching me some things. What do you think? Did I manage to seduce you?
You're a talented student... I can definitely tell Machiko-san has been working her magic on you.
It's been fun playing with Chi-chan again! I never realized just how much I missed the old days. It's really great, you know. And it's all thanks to you, Takahiro-kun.
Before I could react, the girl leaned forward and kissed me gently on the cheek. She quickly pulled back and smiled at me, a faint blush on her cheeks.
W-What was that for?
Hehe, don't worry about it. Maybe it's really for the best that you'll be leaving. It makes it all a bit more fair.
Ah! You don't have to worry about that.
I promised Maeko-chan that I would come back here once I've dealt with things back home. And since a real man doesn't break his promises, you're going to be stuck with me again soon enough.
Really!? I'm glad to hear that! You've done a lot for this village. I would hate to see you go...
Oh, right. Tsuyuri, the... uh, shrine spirit. She mentioned something earlier today.
Oh? Was that the thing you wanted to talk to us about?
Yeah. She basically said something both you and Miyo-san need to hear.
However, before I could continue, it appeared I had been too late.
Miyo had finally caught up with us, depressed and angry with herself for spending almost a month's worth of wages on a silly game. But before she could speak, the village elder rushed up to us.
Tsukino-dono! Narumi-chan! Are you alright?
The three of us glanced at each other, a bit surprised by the arrival of the village elder, who came running towards us, panting heavily.
It's the spirits! T-They are throwing a tantrum near the bonfire. At this rate, they will ruin the festival!
Spirits? This was what I needed to talk to you about! We need to stop them before they cause any more trouble. Elder-sama, I need you to find Maeko-chan and Machiko-san.
I will look for them right away. Tsukino-dono, Narumi-chan, your weapons have been prepared for you.
It wasn't long before we reached the village plaza. As luck would have it, we arrived just as the two other girls got there.
In the center, the bonfire had been put out, and climbing up the support beams were four strange shapes. I recognized one of them as the slime girl, Sakura, but the other three were unrecognizable.
What's going on? Did you come to ruin the festival?
You're the meanypants from before!
Ah, so he's the human who made Machiko-chan and Maeko-chan betray us.
It's their own fault...
That's right! Those wicked humans didn't invite us to their party! That was really mean of them!
We did not betray anyone! The ones causing trouble are you four! We are simply trying to get along with the humans, to work together! All you ever do is cause trouble!
You were not invited because you could not be trusted! You have ruined our bonfire, terrorized our people, and upset the proceedings!
All because you felt you had been snubbed. All because of your own actions! You have no one to blame for this but yourselves!
Ah, it's the monkey girl with the sharp stick!
Hmph. Look who is talking. It's the slime girl with the stupid face!
That... could have been better, but I applaud you for your effort, Miyo-chan. Nice work!
Maeko-chan. Do you remember the spells we found the other day? The ones in your book?
Uh... I think so! The ones like the one I did before?
It worries me that I know exactly what that girl is referring to...
Do you think you can do both of them? I know it's difficult, but I believe in you! I know you can do it!
Yeah! Go Maeko-chan!
Do you really think I would fall for the same trick? Hah! Sisters, we should show them why we are undefeated!
As the sisters darted towards us, Maeko unleashed her first spell. The glowing light billowed up from her hands and shot forwards.

The spell struck the yellow girl head on, but seemed to have no effect. As they got closer, Sakura shifted to the front, and the twin blades of Narumi and Miyo struck, slicing through her body without any effort.

I managed to duck as a large ball of pink slime shot past me. As soon as I was back on my feet, I barged into one of the other slime girls. Surprisingly enough, she turned out to have quite a lot of mass.
Hahaha! Magic can't hurt Tsuki! And physical attacks can't hurt me! We are completely undefeatable! Surrender your village to us and we might just let you all keep living here! As our toys!
Uhm... This is bad!
Not yet... Maeko! Use the other spell! Now!
The girl nodded and began to cast her spell, stepping in front of Machiko who seemed to be preparing something of her own, staff in hand.
I found it a bit strange. I didn't recall seeing any staff lying around, and she usually did not carry any with her. But for whatever reason, she had access to it now.
But it won't work! It'll just--
Trust me, Maeko-chan! I wouldn't ask you to do something like this, if I wasn't sure it would work!
As Sakura kept the two female guards busy, the two other slime girls began taunting us, throwing discarded fruit in our direction.
HAAH!

I leapt towards the yellow slime girl, slamming into her at full speed, and managed to knock her over. The girl let out a surprised yelp, and watched in horror as Maeko's spell soared past her, hitting Sakura in the back.
A high-pitched scream escaped from the pink slime girl.
That hurts!
Uh... How did you... do that, Taka-nii?
Yeah, how'd you push her over? Our blades won't even make a scratch!
Remember what she said? She's the only one immune to physical attacks! The others can be hit and cut just fine!
And that is absolutely perfect for what I have right here! A special present from the guardian of the shrine herself! Taka-kun, Naru-tan, Miyo-san, hold them tight!
Working as one, we nodded, and charged towards the remaining slime girls. Maeko had Sakura in the grasp of her spell, and the pink girl could barely move thanks to her power.
The slime girls had clearly not been expecting us to fight back, and with barely any resistance, we soon had each girl restrained.
I hope you girls aren't claustrophobic. It is going to get a little tight.
One by one, Machiko brought each slime girl a glass jar. And one by one, she opened them, pressing them to the girls' stomachs.
The jars started to pull at them, slowly drawing them inside the container, trapping what appeared to be a tiny version of each of the girls within each jar.
Machiko quickly pushed the lids back onto each jar, displaying them proudly to the cheers of nearby villagers.
Thank goodness you were around, Machiko-san! And you, Maeko-chan. You have our gratitude.
No! My sisters... What have you done to them? Why are you so intent on ruining all our fun!?
Sakura, take a moment to look around you. Look at the destruction, the damage. How could this possibly be fun? Terrorizing people, scaring them, and destroying what they have worked hard for.
How would you feel if they came to your home, stole your food, and wrecked the place?
I never... really thought about it like that... W-We just wanted to play with the humans, like you do...
Nnnhhh!!
As Maeko collapsed, the spell seemed to disperse. Thankfully, I had been anticipating this, and caught her in my arms with ease. The three of us looked to Sakura, who was slowly getting to her feet.
And you can! You and your sisters can play with us. We just ask that you are careful. Maeko and I are proof that humans and spirits can coexist.
But... what about my sisters?
They will be fine! These jars contain a temporary holding dimension. Tsuyuri designed them to hold things far larger than your sisters.
Slime gi... Sakura. If you are truly repentant, then I, as head of the village guard, will authorize your release. However, before I do, I need you to swear an oath.
Do you swear that you and your sisters will not cause problems in this village, and that you will work towards helping us, and protect us?
In return, we are prepared to offer you access to our supplies and services.
She's basically saying that you're welcome in the village as long as you and your sisters behave.
Yes, I swear! We'll be good! So please, release my sisters! I promise we will all be good.
Aww, I just missed the best part. How did it go, Machi-tan? Are my jam bottles filled?
Hearing the voice of a certain playful spirit, the group turned around and found Tsuyuri seated nearby, swaying her legs back and forth as she looked at the crowd.
I... I cannot tell whether you are joking or not, but I am afraid I cannot allow you to keep them. They are honorary citizens of this village, and therefore under my protection.
How fascinating~ To think that the huffy, uptight Miyo-tan would defend those troublemakers.
You do realize you are talking to the guardian deity of your village, do you not?
D-Don't forget about me! I'm n-not going to just sit by and let you do as you please!
Mmm~ The girls of this village have grown into quite the brave little ladies. You must be proud, Haya-kun.
A soft cough came from behind a group of people as the village elder revealed himself, a smile on his lips.
It seems like they handled the matter just fine, Tsuyuri-sama.
Machi-tan, you need to pull the lid off of the jar to release them. However, make sure you hold on to that staff I gave you. It is your only means of channeling the necessary magic.
Not everyone can be a prodigy like Maeko-chan~
The older fox spirit nodded. With the help of Narumi, they began to free the captured slime girls. While the work continued, Tsuyuri eventually made her way towards me, a frown upon her face.
I left out an important detail, Takahiro-kun. The gateway to your world has been opened, and will be closing again within a matter of minutes. If you wish to return to your world, you must leave now.
But-
There is no time for farewells, Takahiro. Leave now, without your farewells, or remain here, in this village.
Hey! Where did Taka-kun run off to? And Tsuyuri?
I do not know. Perhaps they had things to discuss in private?
Nyehe! Or maybe he's gone to win me another prize!
Or went to get some food? I'm still a bit peckish...
Recalling the promise I had made, I turned my back to the girls that had gathered around the released slime girls, and followed Tsuyuri as she picked her way through the streets, and into the woods.
It was unfortunate that I didn't get to say my farewells, but I had a goal to accomplish.
It is a hard decision to make... However, I doubt that this is the last we hear from you, Takahiro.
The spirit smiled, her hands pressed against my shoulder, a light shove pushing me backwards.
What was that fo...?!
Interrupted by sudden dizziness, the last thing I heard was the spirit's amused whisper.
Good luck. You're going to need it!
Before I had the chance to reply, I felt my body getting heavy. My vision blurred, and soon, I was consumed entirely by darkness.
Two months later
With a sigh, I wandered along the familiar path leading to the shrine I subconsciously come to call 'Tsuyuri's shrine'. Two months had passed since the fated judo tournament.
It had turned out to be an amazing experience! Thanks to Narumi and Miyo's training, I had been able to make my way to the finals and ended up becoming the champion.
But not everything went as planned. Even though I was kind of embarrassed by it all, I declined the proposal for me to start playing on an international level.
When I announced, that the reason I declined was because of a girl, it quickly made headlines all over the country.
'Rising judo star ends career for the sake of true love.'
Many silly things ended up being written about me, but it didn't matter.

I had declined their offer because of the promise I had made to Maeko. That I would return once I had finished my business in this world. But perhaps I had been too na√Øve, thinking that it would be as easy as that.
I had been visiting the shrine every day for two months, praying and calling out for Tsuyuri, but none were ever answered.
Knowing her, she's probably laughing her rear off at me, standing here, shouting like this.
I smiled a bit as I looked around the area, recalling how familiar it looked to the place I had visited with the fox spirits.
Speaking of which... Although nothing remained of the village, it turned out that there may have been a connection between it and the city of my world.
Many generations ago, when the city was still a small town, a group of malicious fiends attacked the village but were later driven out. Sometime afterwards, they named this city 'Tsukino Toshi'.
A city named after a certain Tsundere? It couldn't be mere coincidence, could it?
Ah, well... Guess I'll visit again tomorrow.
... aka-nii...
Huh?
Through the rustling of the trees, I thought I had heard a voice. The moment I turned around to look, a circle of unfamiliar symbols formed at my feet.
W-Wait! What happened to the old methods?!
Before I had a chance to figure out what was going on, the circle lit up and I felt the ground below me disappear!
It felt as though I was falling through a tunnel of sorts. A dark, never-ending tunnel that went on for what felt like several minutes, until suddenly, a light came into view and...
W-Watch out!
Before I knew it, I found myself dropping out of the air right on top of two girls standing below me, causing the three of us to topple onto the grass with a loud thud.
I heard grumbling from the two I had landed on and opened my eyes.
Owww... That really hurt!
See? This is what happens when you try to cast magic beyond your own capabilities! Maeko-chan, you need to give up on this. This hunt of yours is going to be the death of you!
I'm not going to give up! Taka-nii made a promise! I made a promise! We would keep trying to find a way to get back to one another! So I'm never, ever, EVER going to stop!
I couldn't believe it. I was so stunned by this turn of events, that I lost all ability to speak. Machiko! Maeko! It was them, here, arguing with one another! It was too good to be true!
You are a fool, Maeko! Even Miyo-san has given up on the hunt. You know what Tsuyuri said. Something like that can only happen when the world itself needs it to.
It takes more than just one person to do what you are trying to accomplish!
Tsu-chan is only saying that because she's mean and lazy! She's lying! You're all lying! I can get him back! I will! WE MADE A PROMISE!

Maeko... I miss him, too. I do. He left a hole in all of our hearts, which you will just need to let time heal. I am sorry that you have to go through all this, but you must believe me. It will get better in time.
It's kind of cruel to talk about me like I died, you know...
TAKA-KUN!
AAAHHH!! TAKA-NII! IT WORKED! I knew it would work! It worked, it worked, it worked! Aaaahahaha!
Taka-kun! It is so good to see you again! I... I'm so... happy to...
The girl mumbled incoherently as she began sobbing. Maeko had been sobbing since she first saw me. I smiled despite still being rather sore from the impact, and patted both of their heads gently.
Did you really miss me that much?
YES!
Your disappearance was the cause of so much concern. Tsuyuri told us you had to leave, and... Well, we understand why you did. Did you... Did you win your tournament?
Of course I did! Thanks to you, I was able to become the champion.
I think it fell down here, Miyo-chan. Hm, I think I see Chi-chan... HEY! CHI-CHAN! IS EVERYTHING ALRIGHT OVER THERE?
Machiko opened her mouth to return the call, but Maeko beat her to it.
HE'S BACK!!!
WHAT?!
No kidding! Where is he?!
There came a loud clambering and rustling from the shrubs nearby, the sound of two girls pushing through the bushes at speed. The two girls rushed into the clearing, gasping loudly.
Oh, wow! You really are back!
IDIOT! Idiot, idiot, idiot! How could you just leave us? Without even saying goodbye!
Miyo! He did not have a choice. He had to--
I KNOW THAT! I know that, but... I just... never... got to say goodbye.
Is that all? Aww, geez, you are such a tsundere!
W-Well, at least I'm not... not... awwh, I don't even care! Takahiro is back!!
Hehe! It's great to see you again, Takahiro-kun! I bet you're a champion now, right? Ready for a fight?
And so it went on. The girls chatted on and on, taking turns in hugging me with promises of never letting go. I was just happy to be back.
As the conversation turned towards the time spent in my own world, I couldn't help but notice the presence of yet another spirit.
Standing a few feet from the rest of the group, Tsuyuri stood, watching us with a gentle smile upon her lips.
I guess I won this bet.

I wasn't sure if she was talking to someone in particular, but for a moment I could see her gaze drifting toward me and the words that left her lips seemingly carried a lot more importance than simple words.
It seems like you aren't done with your grand adventure just yet, Takahiro! I look forward to seeing how you plan to amuse me this time.
What do you mean?
You will see, dear boy. You will see.
Every great story has a humble beginning.
Although Gushiken Takahiro's story has come to an end...
It is only the prologue of what has yet to come.
We hope to see you again next time!
